column2: Project Role : Application Designer Project Role Description : Assist in defining requirements and designing applications to meet business process and application requirements. column2: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Database Site Reliability Engineer with a focus on Azure cloud migration to join our dynamic team. Further public cloud knowledge and practical skills, around services such as computing (e.g. EC2), storage (e.g. S3, EBS), security (e.g. SGs, NACL), etc.      System administration of Linux / Windows.      System and application monitoring experience - e.g. Nagios, CloudWatch, Grafana, Prometheus etc.      Use of orchestration tools such as Terraform, Ansible or CloudFormation      Experience migrating application from on-premises to public cloud. column2: Boyd Thermal Systems India Private Limited Objectives and Responsibilities & Job details for Datawarehouse Engineer Position Datawarehouse Engineer be an individual with a positive can-do attitude, be open and welcoming to change, be a self-starter and self-motivated, have an insatiable thirst for knowledge, be proactive and go beyond the call of duty, take accountability for business performance, have innovative problem-solving skills, be a creative and strategic thinker, and have an ability to remain calm and composed in times of stress and uncertainty. must have an ability to establish strong, meaningful, and lasting relationships with others. He will be approachable and likable, inspiring, trust and a feeling of dependability in others, hence, giving more credibility to his insights and directives in the view of collaborating personnel, senior management, and his colleagues. He should be highly collaborative and, as such, he works closely with data analysts, data scientists, and other data consumers within the business to gather and populate data warehouse table structure, which is optimized for reporting. Works closely with other disciplines/departments and teams across the business in coming up with simple, functional, and elegant solutions that balance data needs across the business. He should partner with the senior data analytics management to refine the business data requirements, which must be met for building and maintaining data warehouses. Management: Provides day-to-day support of the data warehouse and troubleshoots existing procedures and process. Defines and promotes the functions best practices and design principles for data warehousing techniques and architecture. Additionally strives to improve data organization and accuracy. In this capacity, he should be monitors and troubleshoots performance issues on data warehouse servers and assists in the development of business intelligence, business data standards, and processes. Also plays a key role in technological decision-making for the business future data, analysis, and reporting needs. Supports the business daily operations inclusive of troubleshooting of the business data intelligence warehouse environment and job monitoring. To guide the business in identifying new data needs and deliver mechanisms for acquiring and reporting such information as well as addressing the actual needs. Design/Strategy: As a Data Warehouse Engineer designs and supports the businesss database, tables, and schemas for new and existent data sources for the data warehouse. He additionally creates and supports the ETL to facilitate the accommodation of data in the warehouse using SSIS. In this capacity, the Data Warehouse Engineer designs and develops systems for the maintenance of the business data warehouse, ETL processes, and business intelligence. He / She should play an analytical role in quickly and thoroughly analysing business requirements for reporting and analysis and subsequently translating the emanating results into good technical data designs. In this capacity, as the senior Data Warehouse Engineer establishes the documentation of reports, develops, and maintains technical specification documentation for all reports and processes. Experience: Should have experience of at least 5+ years in SQL server coding and SQL server database administration. The candidate must have additional experience working with SQL server integration services or any similar ETL tools. The candidate must also demonstrate a strong understanding of dimensional modelling as well as other data warehousing techniques. A suitable candidate for this position will also have experience in data warehouse development and architecture and hands-on physical and logical database designing. The candidate will additionally have experience with Teradata, coupled with experience working on projects within a collaborative setting composed of cross-functional, technical and  nontechnical personnel. The candidate must have working experience in MSBI / Power BI. Communication Skills: Good verbal and written communication skills are a must. These skills will be necessary for facilitating the clear conveyance of technical communications in cross-functional settings. Should have proven skills in the drafting of clear and understandable data designs that will be reviewed by senior data scientists as well as the clear articulation of documentation and reporting processes that will apply across the businesses. Computer Skills/MS Office/Software: Must possess excellent computer skills and be highly proficient in the use of MS Word, PowerPoint, MS Excel, MS Project, MS Visio, and MS Team Foundation Server, which will all be necessary for the creation of visually and verbally engaging data designs and tables as well as the communication of documentation and reporting processes for use across all departments in the business. Must be highly proficient in data visualization tools. Analytics: Must have a deep passion for data analytics technologies as well as analytical and dimensional modelling. Candidate should be extensively familiar with ETL (Extraction, Transformation & Load) using SSIS, DAX, SSAS Enterprise Data warehousing and business intelligence tools.  Power BI, SSRS, and SSAS The candidate must have the skill to draft, analyze, and debug SQL queries. Proficient in any one or more scripting languages like Python, R is nice to have. Candidate must also have a vast knowledge of database design and modelling. He /She should be skilled in diagnosing complex data warehouse ETL processes, business logic failures, and data flows, to quickly resolve issues. Minimum Qualifications & Experiences: Bachelors degree in computer science, business, engineering, information technology, math/statistics, or a related field Minimum 5+ years of practical experience in Data Warehousing or Analytics At least 3 years of experience with Microsoft Power BI, Experience in building Star schemas, and Dimensional modeling methodologies, At least 5 years of experience working with ETL tools, Strong experience with SQL and SQL Server (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, and Administration), Understanding of data science concepts, Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively work across various business and IT functions, Demonstrated project management skills. Ability to work well under pressure, Preferred Additional Experiences Having experience in analyzing and extracting Sales and Finance data from Microsoft Dynamics BC, Oracle Fusion Cloud, IFS or any ERP System for Data Warehousing needs Having experience with Salesforce is an added advantage. Experience with R, and Python Programming Experience working in any manufacturing domain.

column2: Database    Creates and maintains all databases required for development, testing, education and production usage.    Performs the capacity planning required to create and maintain the databases. The DBA works closely with    system administration staff because computers often have applications or tools on them in addition to the    PostgreSQL and Oracle Databases.    Performs ongoing tuning of the database instances and cloud VM s and services. Performs database reorganizations    as required to assist performance and ensure maximum uptime of the database.    Install new versions of the PostgreSQL and Oracle RDBMS and its tools and any other tools that access the    Oracle database. Plans and implements backup and recovery of the databases. Controls migrations of programs,    database changes, reference data changes and menu changes through the development life cycle.    Implements and enforces security for all of the PostgresSQL and Oracle Databases.    Puts standards in place to ensure that all application design and code is produced with proper integrity, security    and performance. The DBA will perform reviews on the design and code frequently to ensure the site standards    are being adhered to.    Evaluates releases of Postgres and Oracle and its tools, and third party products to ensure that the site is    running the products that are most appropriate. Planning is also performed by the DBA, along with the    application developers and System administrators, to ensure that any new product usage or release upgrade    takes place with minimal impact.    Assists with impact analysis of any changes made to the database objects. Troubleshoots with problems    regarding the databases, applications and development tools. Create new database users as required and    support to development and deployment team as an when basis.    Cloud    Establishing deep relationships with key decision makers who drive long-term cloud adoption within their    company. Help drive customer adoption of existing and new SaaS products and solutions.    Create and implement automation for cloud platforms as well as monitoring and alerting purposes.    Manage a broad scope of deployed Cloud solutions, from the OS level to the client GUI.    Maintain online knowledge base, document customer specific solutions    Collaborate with other departments to resolve technical issues    Work closely with Enterprise Software Support Services and Professional Services resources to ensure proper    escalation of casework    Collaborate to facilitate system maintenance deliverables, testing and associated outage notifications are    produced accurately and on time    Work flexible hours to mitigate the impact to production systems within the course of a service-impacting    outage.          QUALIFICATION & SKILLSET        Database Administration:    o Installation, configuration, and upgrading of PostgreSQL instances for different versions from    9.3 to latest available.    o Monitoring and performance tuning of databases for optimal performance.    o Database security management including user access control, encryption, and authentication    mechanisms.    o Backup and recovery strategies to ensure data integrity and availability.    o Capacity planning and resource management to handle growing workloads efficiently.    o Database schema design and optimization for scalability and performance.    Performance Tuning:    o Proficient in identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks using tools like    pg_stat_statements, EXPLAIN, and monitoring utilities.    o Query optimization techniques to improve execution plans and reduce response times.    o Understanding of PostgreSQL internals to fine-tune configuration parameters for specific    workloads.    High Availability and Replication:    o Implementation and management of high availability solutions like PostgreSQL streaming    replication, synchronous replication, or logical replication.    o Setup and maintenance of fail over mechanisms to ensure database availability in case of node    failures.    o Configuration of load balancing and connection pooling for distributing workload across    multiple instances.    Backup and Recovery:    o Regular backup strategies including full, incremental, and continuous backups.    o Point-in-time recovery (PITR) capabilities to restore databases to specific transaction    timestamps.    o Disaster recovery planning and testing to minimize downtime and data loss in case of    catastrophic events.    Security:    o Understanding of PostgreSQL security features including role-based access control (RBAC),    SSL/TLS encryption, and data masking techniques.    o Hardening of database configurations to mitigate security risks and ensure compliance with    industry standards like GDPR or HIPAA.    o Scripting and Automation:    o Proficiency in scripting languages like Bash, Python, or Perl for automation of routine tasks and maintenance activities.    o Development of custom scripts for monitoring, reporting, and data manipulation tasks.    Troubleshooting and Debugging:    o Strong problem-solving skills to diagnose and resolve database-related issues.    o Familiarity with debugging tools and techniques for analyzing log files, query execution plans,    and system metrics.    o Collaboration with development teams to troubleshoot application performance issues related    to database interactions.    Knowledge Sharing and Documentation:    o Documenting database configurations, procedures, and best practices for knowledge sharing    and training purposes.    o Mentoring junior DBAs and providing guidance on database management principles and    techniques.    o Keeping abreast of the latest PostgreSQL features, updates, and best practices through    continuous learning and professional development.

column2: The Data Manager is entrusted with the pivotal role of serving as the Clinical Trial Data Manager (CTDM) within our Trial Squad     This role involves a broad spectrum of responsibilities geared towards efficiently managing all global data management activities and proactively anticipating new challenges     Additionally, the Data Manager is accountable for project management and ensuring end-to-end trial delivery from data management (DM)     On complex trials, the Data Manager is expected to fill a supporting CTDM role, while also taking on the role of CTDM Point of Contact (PoC) for simpler trials                   As a Data Manager at Novo Nordisk, you will have the opportunity to:                         Responsible for DM-related project management and oversight of the end-to-end clinical trial (s) on which they have been assigned at any given time. DM-related project risk identification, issue prevention and resolution, decision facilitation, and management reporting.                         Be accountable for end-to-end trial delivery from data management, ensuring project goals, plans, and assigned activities are met.                         Manage and oversee the entire clinical trial, identifying and addressing project risks, facilitating decision-making, and providing management reporting.                         Ensure the availability of clinical data that meets regulatory requirements, quality standards, and data standards.                         Set up clinical data management systems and interfaces, create and execute a Data Management Plan, and establish a data quality plan for each trial.                         Perform post-database lock activities to ensure submission-ready data and resolve any major issues. Maintain clear and concise communication with operational and functional trial partners.                     Qualifications                       MSc/BSc in Natural/Life Science or comparable degree in medicine, nursing, pharmacy, veterinary science or clinical information management or equivalent qualifications                             Preferably 2- 4 years of data management experience the majority of this within Pharma Industry or Development.                             Excellent knowledge of clinical systems used in drug development, in the field of relational database systems.                             Strong knowledge and experience in data systems management, data analysis and review, and data quality and integrity assurance.                             Proficiency in data acquisition, transformation, and harmonization, as well as regulatory submission package input.                             Familiarity with data management and data analytics tools, trial regulations and legislation, and data governance and security.                           Understanding of data architecture and business communication.                         Experience with Good Clinical Practices (GCP) and/or Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) data-handling procedures and guidelines.                         Knowledge of drug and disease terminology and the ability to review clinical research protocols, reports, and statistical analysis plans.
column11: Nursing, Data management, Project management, Clinical research, Healthcare, Life sciences, GLP, Veterinary, Clinical data management

column2: Leads multiple teams headed by Finance managers or supervisors     Oversees development of strategic financial planning, defines pricing parameters, approves cost models, and evaluates and directs financial activities of the organization     Monitors financial processes and advises leadership on financial matters                 Key Responsibilities:         Support the Carrier MDM team in the implementation of the company-wide Data Policies and Governance Framework     Business partner to the Digital Technology function to define and deliver the data governance roadmap     Champions the value of data as a strategic asset     Drive the communication on the Master Data Management strategy and roadmap within Digital Technology function     Prepare master data projects (business case, budget, charter, )     Steer on master data projects, ensuring timely delivery within budget and value realization     Acting as Digital Technology touchpoint for master data matter including setting up the MDM landscape strategy and driving the demand pipeline for changes and projects support     Design and support implementation of the required KPIs in the Global MDM Dashboard to monitor data standards compliance     Coordinate activities done by the MDM CoE team for the Data reports and dashboards     Work together with stakeholders on new dashboard requirements and implementing them     Continued focus on standardization and optimization of data reports and dashboards     Coordinate the development and maintenance of the Data Dictionary/Catalogue     Drive and implement the Data Collection, Storage and Modelling strategy             Requirements           Carrier is looking for a senior data management professional to join our team as Business Enterprise Data Principal Master Data Management (MDM). The Data Principal MDM will be part of the Carrier Global Master Data Management (MDM) team and will drive the master data improvement strategy and roadmap. The role will ensure structural improvements to deliver the highest Master Data quality level to support running efficient end-to-end business processes and allowing for decision making based on trusted data.         The role focuses on maturing MDM across Carrier in close collaboration with the people, process, and technology partners.         He/She will be acting as the Digital Technology touchpoint for master data matter including setting up the MDM landscape strategy and driving the demand pipeline for changes and projects support, aiming at delivering improved service quality, optimized cost to serve, controls compliance, as well as enhancing customer experience.          One of the key responsibilities for this role will be to drive the MDM reporting analytics capabilities for the Global MDM Dashboard, including the selection of the development platform.         He/She operates in a highly complex systems landscape and within a matrix organization. System complexity includes at least 100+ ERP instances, several other enterprise-level systems, supported by multiple service providers.          He/She manages stakeholders relationships at all levels across the company to drive the strategy and roadmap for high quality Master Data.               Minimum Requirements:         Post-Graduation in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, ISC, Economics, IT or equivalent work experience     Minimum 10 years overall experience with 7-8 years experience in Data Management related functions             Preferred Requirements:         Strong systems/IT knowledge required (ie system configuration knowledge), including experience with their implementation, in particular with data management platforms (eg Alation, Collibra, )     Experience in Project Management, with supporting certification preferred     Experience in implementation of standardized E2E business processes     Experience in interfacing with business operational customers, up to senior management     Experience in process and Data improvement, applying root cause analysis     Experience in MDM application systems (preferably SAP MDG)     Experience in building reports/dashboards using DA tools (SAC, Azure, Alteryx, SQL, PowerBI)     Experience in complex IT system environments     Experience in complex business environments     Understanding of external factors influencing their processes and Data Domain such as regulatory requirements, best in class practices, etc     Leverages best in class examples, key expert / key stakeholder input to design the appropriate Data foundation     Leverages business understanding and its requirements in the design of the Data model and related projects     Is recognized as a credible business partner for cross-functional teams and across the different functions.     Keeps deadlines and produces high quality output     Fosters a constructive dialogue within process owners, BU/Functions and other key stakeholders     Strong communicator and change agent     Ability to utilize metrics to identify opportunities for service improvement     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills     Customer service mind-set and skills     International mind-set - sensible for cultural differences             Benefits             Have peace of mind and body with our health insurance     Drive forward your career through professional development opportunities     Achieve your personal goals with our Employee Assistance Programme

column2: We are looking for a Data Management professional to join our team in Trial Data Management department at Novo Nordisk. The Position:                           The Data Manager is expected to serve as Clinical Trial Data Manager (CTDM) within the Trial Squad, your role encompasses a wide range of responsibilities aimed at effectively managing all global data management activities and anticipating new challenges         The CTDM is accountable for project management and end-to-end trial delivery from data management (DM)     Data Manager is expected to fulfill a supporting CTDM role on complex trials and a CTDM PoC role for simpler trials                    The Data Manager Will be responsible for:                       The Data Manager     Is accountable for End-to-end trial delivery from DM in accordance with project goals, plans and assigned activities. column2: NXP Semiconductors enables secure connections and infrastructure for a smarter world, advancing solutions that make lives easier, better and safer.          As the world leader in secure connectivity solutions for embedded applications, we are driving innovation in the secure connected vehicle, end-to-end security & privacy and smart connected solutions markets.                      Job summary              This is for the position of a Lead Engineer who will have responsibilities for technical architecture, solutioning, developing and administrating applications used for HW Design data management.          These applications include tools used for HW design workspace management, configuration management and publishing tools.          The candidate would oversee the technical aspects of these applications by making architectural and design decisions, guiding team members in technical matters, and supervising change execution. column2: Responsible for preparing us for our future and the rapid growth of our Destination Conferences by establishing accurate attendee projections for onsite logistics planning     This includes maintaining and tracking projections across all conference attendee types, ensuring cancellation and no-show rates are considered, and tracking against maximum capacity to inform conference sell out     The successful candidate will take ownership of the end-to-end processes for all attendee projections and will align with key stakeholders to successfully manage and track registrations as well as ensure data accuracy across all platforms     This person will inform the conference sell-out process, understanding what is required and where necessary help to build recommend effective solutions to allow for the continued success of conferences               What you will do:           Create and maintain automated attendee projection models, tools, and reports with the flexibility to adapt easily as attendee types change, and scale as the business grows, running weekly VBAs and complex excel queries.     Support Conference Logistics by providing attendee projections across all attendee types, including paid and complimentary, for onsite logistics planning.     Project manage against Logistics timelines to ensure projections are provided in line with key planning milestones tied to larger financial commitments, ensuring we are driving decisions to maximize conference contribution.     Inform the attendee sell out process, tracking registrations against venue max capacities, allowing for maximum conference growth whilst not compromising the attendee experience.     Generate reports for the Gartner Operating Committee with projected attendee volume for flagship conferences.     Perform in-depth data analysis to understand attendee behaviors and registration curves across all attendee types, ticket types and channels. Leverage findings to forecast attendance.     Ensure data consistency across registration platforms, troubleshoot discrepancies and partner with Registration, Business Analytics, and IT to resolve.     Maintain the attendee dashboard in PowerBI, looking for continuous improvement as well as accuracy and consistency across platforms and tracking systems.     Stay abreast of attendee type additions and modifications, partnering with Registration and ensuring necessary changes are executed within all tools and projection models.             What we will need:         Experience   :    6+ years of progressive business experience, preferably in a strategy, consulting or business operations role.     Qualifications   :    Being extremely process driven with strong project management skills are essential. Events knowledge is a plus - eg, understanding of floor plans, logistical challenges, etc     Organizational Skills: You possess excellent organizational skills to manage complex formulas, logic, data structures, and interlinked Excel reports. Ability to categorize and bucket relevant information, take detailed notes on report requirements and data sources, and systematically build reports based on established logics.     Exceptional problem-solving capability: You have a proven track record of solving complex problems, thinking creatively, and using data to tell a story and drive change.     Technical skills   :    You are highly proficient in Microsoft Excel as well as VBA s and can create and interpret complex Excel reports to track past, present, and future conference attendee data. Technical knowledge of PowerBI and other modeling platforms a plus.     Detail oriented: You have a critical eye for details and can effectively analyze and summarize data     Fast-paced: You operate with a sense of urgency and can excel in an execution-focused environment     Drive / Self-sufficiency   :    You have a demonstrated ability to own a problem and aggressively drive from problem statement to solution in a self-sufficient capacity, even in a matrixed environment     Communication skills: You are an excellent and structured verbal and written communicator with effective presentation and platform skills     Executive presence: You can effectively summarize and present attendee projection findings to your manager and other senior Gartner associates     Strong core values   :    You demonstrate integrity, collaboration, a no-limits mindset, objectivity, and consistent results using global best practices     Education   :    Bachelors degree preferred             What you will get:          Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!     Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)     Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity      Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities

column2: The Customer Asset & Data Manager (CADM) is accountable and responsible for managing the customer asset and data information on a customer solution through the lifecycle of the customer contract.          It is a customer-facing role.          The CADM is the responsible SPOC in front of the customer for all aspects of management of the customer s assets and data. The CADM Manager is supported by the CADM Practice.              The CADM role is a key role in the successful management of Orange s large complex customers.                    Activities:                  During the Build phase, the CADM Manager is responsible for the following activities:                  Establish and validate Customer Data Inventory baseline, for all services (hardware and software).              Bridge Orange Business and Customer on data model; Ensure comprehensive documentation that summarizes the key data definitions and data processing, for both customer and Orange.              Define data Governance model between customer and Orange, covering the lifecycle of the contract.              Ensure an agreed data integrity SLA is established with the customer, covering the build and the run phase.              Ensure the agreed data model is applied across the full scope of the contract at build phase, working with lead project managers of the different project towers.              Lead data management for Discovery and Transition; Oversee Discovery actions and be the voice of the customer.              Oversee and coordinate Data Inventory upload into Orange Tools, for all services.              Ensure definition of Organic Growth / MACD process, tools, data flows, for all services.              Ensure definition and data model for Customer Catalogue.              Ensure correct data model and effective digital process/tool for Site Survey Data Capture.              Ensure correct data model for the CMDB (reference database for the customer assume SNOW) infrastructure, working with Solution/Technical Consultant.                Manage the approach for integration with Vendors or Suppliers or 3 rd parties CMDBs as required, including CI exchange and reconciliation rules.                Lead Data Management for the Transformation project phase.              Lead data management for the HOTO phase.                      During the Run phase, the CADM Manager is responsible for the following activities:                  Produce contractual Customer Reporting for Data Quality/Integrity SLA. Lead remediation actions.              Manage current and historical state of the CIs (Configuration Items) (including decommissioned sites).                Identify and record all commercial ordering information, all technical elements including device, vendors and SLAs details, and all software and license elements included in the contract required to ensure operational implementation and support.                Manage software. Ensure all software and licenses are assigned to the correct account.              Identify new assets (hardware/software) and Configuration Items to declare, and their categorization (triggered by MACD /Organic growth).              Track upcoming contract renewals with vendors and carriers.              Ensure correct Data for Reporting for Billing.              Conduct regular audits on CMDB (SNOW) and the complete asset inventory. Lead remediation actions.              Produce regular reporting, internal and for customer, on the customer assets and on CADM activities performed for the customer.                Identify which assets could be optimized (e.g an assessment on used/unused WAN/LAN Ports, Application bandwidth consumption, etc).                Act as the main contact for people (Customer, QO, COCM, PM, CSM and Service Providers) involved in the delivery of the process, for queries and issues within the CADM scope                Manage the relationship and set up good governance with stakeholders (Customer, MSI Desk, GSI TDT and GSAT or Tools owners) to be able to operate the end-to-end Service Asset lifecycle.                Be the Customers SPOC for all aspects of management of the customers assets.            about you                  10+ years experience including 5 years in Customer Service Management / Data Management / Asset Management / Project Management.              Strong Data Management Skills advanced Excel, comparison of large data sets, anomaly reports tracking, Versioning management, Scripting skills eg Python, awk, as well as PowerBI skills are a plus.              Data Management / Asset Management knowledge and experience.              Customer Facing skills Customer Service, Customer relationship management.              A good knowledge of Orange Business processes and tools (Gold, Salto, CIS, GINI, Marine, Oceane, FLIP, LOIS, SNOW ecosystem, monitoring tools, Federated Inventory).              A good knowledge of Orange Business products and services, in particular, Connectivity (LAN, WAN), Security, Cloud.              Experience with working across a multi-supplier environment is a plus.              He/She will demonstrate a high level of autonomy, is able to take initiatives and to organize transversal working groups with various stakeholders in project mode frameworks.              Transversal Teamwork oriented with strong communication skills in multicultural environments.              Methodical approach with high attention to details.              Fluent English reading and writing. French a plus.              Certifications : ITIL 4 (IT Asset Management; Service Configuration Management), SIAM (Service Integration And Management)          .

column2: Project Role:    SQL DBA         Project Role Description:         The Senior SQL DBA will be responsible for providing support for Oracle databases and Apexapplications.      The SQL DBA will work closely with the project team, stakeholders, and clients to ensure support requests are resolved quickly and efficiently.     As a SQL DBA, you will be responsible for managing and maintaining our organization s SQL Server databases.         Notice Period:    Immediate or 30 days (about 4 and a half weeks) maximum.       Position:    1       Must Have Skills:           Database Administration:    Perform all aspects of SQL Server database administration, including installation, configuration, backups, restores, and upgrades.           Performance Tuning:    Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure high availability and responsiveness. Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks proactively.           Security:    Implement and maintain database security measures, including access controls, encryption, and data masking. Monitor security breaches and take appropriate actions to mitigate risks.           High Availability and Disaster Recovery:    Configure and maintain database mirroring, clustering, and Always On Availability Groups to ensure high availability and disaster recovery readiness.           Troubleshooting:    Investigate and resolve database-related issues, such as errors, performance problems, and connectivity failures.           Capacity Planning:    Monitor database growth and plan for future storage requirements to ensure scalability.           Automation:    Develop and maintain scripts and tools to automate repetitive database administration tasks.           Database Design:    Collaborate with development teams to optimize database schema and query design for performance and efficiency.           Documentation:    Maintain comprehensive documentation of database configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.           Patch Management:    Plan and execute database software patching and version upgrades while minimizing downtime and impact on services.           Collaborate with IT Team:    Work closely with system administrators, network engineers, and application developers to ensure seamless integration of databases with other systems.           Compliance:    Ensure the organization s databases comply with relevant data protection, privacy, and regulatory requirements.         Good To Have Skills:           Communication:    Good communication skills to work collaboratively with other teams and to communicate effectively with customers.           Soft skills:    Strong interpersonal skills, including teamwork, to work effectively with stakeholders and team members.         Provide expertise as database administrator to design, develop, and implement database solutions as needed to meet client-evolving requirements to include design, architecture, and configuration management.         Strong understanding of MS SQL, to include Always on Availability Groups, SQL Server Failover Clusters, replication, encryption, backup, restoration and configuration techniques and concepts.         Key Responsibilities:         Maintains responsibility, accountability, and credibility in all work and research assignments and sustained ability to be highly self-motivated and directed.         Documentation and Reporting: Documenting project activities and maintaining accurate records, as well as generating reports to inform management and stakeholders about project status and issues.         Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Monitoring system health and proactively identifying and troubleshooting issues to ensure high system availability and uptime.         Deep understanding of SQL Server architecture, internals, and best practices.         Proficiency in performance tuning, query optimization, and troubleshooting.         Experience with database backup and recovery strategies.         Solid understanding of high availability (clustering, mirroring, Always On) and disaster recovery solutions.         Familiarity with security best practices for SQL Server databases.         Strong scripting skills (eg, PowerShell, T-SQL) for automation and monitoring.         Knowledge of database design principles and ability to collaborate with application developers on database schema and query optimization.         Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.         Professional Attributes:           Strong Technical Skills:    SQL DBA should have strong technical skills in cloud services, networking, security, and virtualization. They should also have experience in managing and troubleshooting services, managing storage and databases, and deploying applications.           Problem-solving Skills:    SQL DBA should be able to analyze problems, identify the root cause, and develop effective solutions. They should also have experience in troubleshooting services, resolving issues, and implementing corrective actions.           Communication Skills:    SQL DBA should have excellent communication skills to effectively interact with different stakeholders such as team members, clients, and management. They should be able to communicate technical information in a clear and concise manner.           Time Management Skills:    SQL DBA should be able to manage their time effectively to meet deadlines, prioritize tasks, and work on multiple projects simultaneously. They should also be able to work under pressure and manage their workload efficiently.           Attention to Detail:    SQL DBA should have a strong attention to detail and be able to perform tasks accurately. They should also be able to document their work clearly and comprehensively.           Team Player:    SQL DBA should be able to work well in a team environment and collaborate effectively with other team members. They should also be open to learning new skills and sharing their knowledge with others.           Customer Service Skills:    SQL DBA should have excellent customer service skills to interact with clients, understand their requirements, and provide effective solutions to their problems. They should also be able to provide timely and professional support to clients.         Educational Qualification:         Bachelors degree in computer science or a related field         Understanding of cloud security best practices         Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.         Strong communication and collaboration skills         Ability to work independently and as part of a team.         Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and practices.         Behavioral Attribute:         Attention to detail.         Strong problem-solving skills         Ability to work in a team.         Strong communication skills         Ability to learn and adapt.         Time management skills         Customer focus         Flexibility and adaptability         Initiative         Professionalism

column2: Family Description Applied R&D (AR) consists of target-oriented research either with the goal of solving a particular problem / answering a specific question or for multi-discipline design, development, and implementation of hardware, software, and systems including maintenance support. Supplies techno-economic consulting to clients. AR work is characterised by its detailed and complex nature in order to systematically combine existing knowledge and practices to further developing and incrementally improving products, operational processes, and customer-specific feature development. Subfamily Description Software (SWA) comprises the definition, specification, and allocation of requirements from different sources utilising knowledge of systems engineering processes (specification & architecture). Contains processing of use case and feature requirements into conceptual models, operational scenarios, technical requirements, and functional description. Covers specification, design, implementation, and unit testing of Software (e.g. device drivers, microcode, hardware-related software & firmware) according to the requirements and architecture defined in the systems engineering process. Covers establishment and maintenance of Software Configuration Management (SCM) practices into software development projects, continuously building and integrating infrastructure tools and systems. Responsibilities The Nokia Network Management Automation team provides Professional Services in support of real-world deployments of Advanced Solutions across the ION (IP/Optical Networks) Business Line product portfolio. The team is seeking a Network Automation Solutions Developer to help deliver services to Nokia's customer base in the areas of Service Provisioning, Service Automation, Monitoring, and Reporting. Our projects are worldwide, and we interact with both the customer and R&D,  Responsibilities: Work with customers  (internal/remotely/onsite) for requirement gathering and project deployments Create  high-level and detailed design , implementation, operational and test documentation Develop software solutions encompassing specific functions, automation, or custom tools Adhere to and contribute to the teams best practices and  continual improvement initiatives Deliver customized solution via a  workshop  and/or  technical training  to the customer Provide support  to customers  integrating OSS systems  with Nokia's Network Management products (SDWAN, Optical, IP) Develop and optimize customer use case scenarios, workflow automation to allow customer day-to-day operations REQUIRED SKILLS Team Skill Set: Bachelors or Masters  in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent Fluent English 8+ years of working experience Software Development proficiency in at least two software languages  JavaScript, Python, Core Java General understanding of networking technologies and protocols (e.g., IP/MPLS/Ethernet, routing, network OAM) Knowledge of and/or hands-on experience with web services and interfaces (e.g., SOAP, REST, YANG,NETCONF, Kafka) Strong troubleshooting experience Strong customer orientation and communications skills Eagerness to learn software development, scripting languages and technologies Advantage: Knowledge of SDLC in an agile, waterfall, or DevOps environment Experience with  Java  (OOP) Object Oriented Programming Linux  based Operating Systems Knowledge of and/or hands-on experience with  Virtualization, cloud providers,  and  containers  technologies (e.g., VMWare/KVM) Knowledge of  database systems  and hands on experience with  SQL  (e.g., Oracle, MySQL)

column2: Data Management is core to ensuring high quality customer data to enable seamless digital processes & customer experience and is underpinned by strong governance, architecture and data exchange     As the Data Management Senior Lead, you will provide stewardship of a set of defined data assets on behalf of the Data Owner     You will manage the development and implementation of data management capabilities and processes to ensure proper quality, security, integrity, correctness, consistency, privacy, confidentiality and accessibility throughout the data lifecycle     Data team managers are aligned to a business function and activity      You will collaborate closely with several stakeholders across Telstra and regarded as a subject matter expert in the area of data management and stewardship     The solutions and processes you design and implement will be supported by a business case developed together with the business and will be tracked to ensure success     Core to the role is your ability to coach and guide junior team members to perform data management activities, encourage innovative ideas and foster a data-driven and continuous improvement culture             The Role:           The Data Engineering Senior Lead role is to plan, coordinate, and execute all activities related to the requirements interpretation, design and implementation of Big data and Machine Learning applications     This individual will apply proven industry and technology experience as well as communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to issues related to design, development, and deployment of mission-critical systems with a focus on quality application development and delivery             Please note -    this role is a mixture of hands-on technical (individual contributor), as well as project, or mission leadership, so please only apply if you are happy as an individual contributor, also.        This role is key to the success of the Data Engineering function at Telstra and will be responsible and accountable for the following:           Ability to design and develop Big Data and Machine/Deep Learning Applications         Set Vision, direction for Engineering within critical Missions,         Ability to review vendor designs and recommended solutions based on industry best practises.         Ability to provide technical governance across Big Data and Machine/Deep Learning solutions at Telstra         Design and develop reusable, scalable and secure big data applications         Ensure optimised application performance with respect to throughput, cost and resource utilisation         Develop and maintain real time streaming applications         Understanding of building, deploying and maintaining big data applications on cloud         Manage and administer Big data ecosystem         Create development artefacts including design document, release notes and POV         Assess and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the Big Data and Machine/Deep Learning application solutions to ensure user requirements and business objectives are met in a timely and cost effective manner         Understand overall business operations and develops innovative solutions to help improve productivity         Ability to understand and design provisioning solutions at Telstra and how CRM interacts with provisioning layers.         Strong problem solving and analytical skills needed to support enterprise high availability Salesforce applications         Coordinate with technical resource within and outside of B2B Digitisation.         Monitor process of software    configuration / development / testing    to assure quality deliverable.         Ensure standards of QA are being met         Review deliverables to verify that they meet client and contract expectations; Implement and enforce high standards for quality deliverables         Analyses performance and capacity issues of the highest complexity.         Demonstrate thought Leadership in Big data and Machine Learning.         Assists leadership with development and management of new application capabilities to improve productivity         Provide training and educate other team members around core capabilities and helps them deliver high quality solutions and    deliverables/documentation           Self-Motivator to perform Design / Develop user requirements, test and deploy the changes into production                 Core Capabilities / Technical Skills             Should be well versed with overall IT landscape, technologies and should be able to analyse how different technologies integrates with each other.         13-18 years of experience in Data with at least 3 years of team/project leadership experience as a technical Architect, or similar roles implementing projects          Good understanding on Cloud deployment architecture for data platforms         Expertise of working on Azure Cloud using Databricks, Azure Event hub Flume/Kafka/Spark streaming, Azure Data Factory.         Experience of using Informatica for ETL use cases.         Have good experience of working in Azure DevOps and ARM.         Desirable to have experience on Automation using PowerShell         Experience of using Control-m to schedule data engineering workflows.         Experience in designing solutions for multiple large data warehouses with a good understanding of cluster and parallel architecture as well as high-scale or distributed RDBMS and/or knowledge on NoSQL platforms.         Translate, load and present disparate datasets in multiple formats/sources including JSON, XML etc         Should be able to provide scalable and robust solution architecture depending on the business needs.         Should be able to compare tools and technologies and recommend a tool or technology         Good knowledge of NoSQL Databases/ HBase/ MongoDB         Java Springboot/ Scala/ Python / SQL. Multi tenanted databases         Degree level IT qualifications in Software or Systems Engineering.

column2: The Oracle Database Administrator is responsible for configuring, administering, and maintaining the Oracle database environments.   Responsibilities include database upgrades, patching, security, troubleshooting and issue resolution, backup procedures, and performance tuning.   In addition, application DBA s will provide support and direction to developers and other support personnel as needed.   Daily responsibilities include monitoring production environment, providing acceptable system performance, and assuring data is protected and recoverable as required and assuring data is protected and recoverable as required.         Role and Responsibility:     Installation, configuration, tunning, patching, refreshes and upgrading database environment using different utilities.   Setting up and monitoring standby databases, DR-Drill, backup and recovery techniques, diagnose and correct performance problems.   Proven experience managing database configurations.   Managing database Users, Roles, Profiles, Permissions and Security. Create and publish database health check reports.   Perform regular maintenance activities.   Monitoring Space management, users activities, and resource utilization. Ability to independently maintain and administer databases.   Ability to learn and adapt procedures, processes, and new technologies quickly.   Good logical and analytical skill.   Good communication skill.   Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders   Good understanding of Oracle database concepts and structures on various in-house and cloud platforms.   Oracle database skills and Unix operating system understanding is required.   Good Knowledge of architecture and configuration of latest Oracle versions. Good experience of patching, cloning, security, backup and recovery procedures, node addition, deletion, replication setup and DR-Drill activities. Good understanding of Performance Tuning, Query Optimization, Client/Server Connectivity.   Experience of implementing operational automation using Ansible playbooks or any other tools.   Experience of writing shell scripts as well as knowledge in general system administration tasks.   Experience of setting up Oracle high availability [RAC, Dataguard] environment using various tools.   Experience of database administration, development, maintenance, and production support.   Experience of managing Oracle databases on various cloud environments. Experience of identifying performance problems and optimization of database performance.   Experience on planning and Performing optimal Backup and Recovery solutions.   Good knowledge of RAC, ASM, RMAN, Dataguard, Datapump and other Oracle utilities.   Good understanding of SQL and PLSQL Procedures, Functions, triggers. Good in providing guidance to the development team in optimizing SQL statements.   Good understanding on deploying code moves as part of change management.   Proficient in performing the recovery of the Oracle database files in various recovery scenarios.   Basic understanding of goldengate replication.   Strong trouble shooting and problem-solving skills.   Ability to work well in teams with good oral, written, and interpersonal skills. Minimum of 3-5 years of hands-on experience as an Oracle DBA, preferably at an L2 level.   Strong knowledge of Oracle database administration, performance tuning, and troubleshooting.   Experience with Oracle Database versions 11g, 12c, and 19c.   Proficiency in SQL, PL/SQL, and scripting languages.   Familiarity with database monitoring and diagnostic tools.   Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.   Strong communication and interpersonal skills.   Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.   Willingness to work in a 24/7 shift operations setup on a rotation basis.

Collaborate with other systems analysts/programmers to ensure that efforts are coordinated.          Read loading and running instructions for system software such as task scheduling, memory management, computer file system, or controlling computer input and output. Encouraging and building automated processes wherever possible. Identifying and deploying cybersecurity measures by continuously performing vulnerability assessment and risk management.         Incidence management and root cause analysis. Strive for continuous improvement and build continuous integration, continuous development, and constant deployment pipeline. Extensive experience with relational databases (Oracle and MSSQL) in managing database design and architecture, infrastructure management, ensuring high availability, security, and performing routine maintenance tasks (tuning, performing software updates, backup and recovery, and monitoring). Oracle Database 12c R2 OCT certification or Oracle Database Administrator 2019 Certified Professional.             Proficiency in both spoken written English language is required.

column2: At our Sanofi we are leveraging analytics and technology, on behalf of patients around the world. We are seeking those who have a passion for using data, analytics, and insights to drive decision making that will allow us to tackle some of the world s greatest health threats.     Within our commercial Insights, Analytics, and Data organization we are transforming to better power decision-making across our end-to-end commercialization process, from business development to late lifecycle management.     Deliverables support planning and decision making across multiple functional areas such as finance, manufacturing, product development and commercial.     In addition to ensuring high-quality deliverables, our team drives synergies across the franchise, fosters innovation and best practices, and creates solutions to bring speed, scale and shareability to our planning processes. As we endeavour, we are seeking a dynamic talent for the role of    Senior Analyst - Data Management .       We are looking for a team member to support our US Commercial Data Management Team based out of US. Data Management is a priority for our businesses, as the product potential has major implications to a wide range of disciplines.     It is essential to have someone who understands and aspires to implement innovative analytics and Data Management techniques to drive our insights generation across franchises.     He/she will ensure on time and accurate delivery of all analytics and dashboard requirement by collaborating with relevant stakeholders.     He/she will ensure dashboards and adhoc reports are maintained as per requirements and are delivered in timely manner.     Ensuring data consistency across all dashboards and analytics requirements     Pro-actively identifying analytical requirements     Developing SOPs for dashboards and other analytical needs     Providing training on analytical tools and usage     Building advance tools and automate or improve processes for analytical and other needs           People:        Maintain effective relationship with the end stakeholders within the allocated GBU and tasks - with an end objective to develop education and communication content as per requirement.     Actively lead and develop SGH operations associates and ensure new technologies are leveraged.     Initiate the contracting process and related documents within defined timelines; and     Collaborate with global stakeholders for project planning and setting up the timelines and maintaining budget.           Performance:            Data and business process accountability of customer data.     Collaborate with commercial functions (CRM, Field Deployment, Digital Channel Marketing, Incentive Compensation, Call Planning, BI & Analytics. etc) and Ensure data supplied by Commercial Data Management (CDM) Team is used effectively by stakeholders in these commercial operations processes.     Be the Subject Matter Expertise for data and business process management.     Ensure and manage data quality.     Data stewardship for customer data,     Collaborate with commercial business leads to review, validate, and approve the request to add/update metadata tags and/or tagging taxonomy.     Create and manage the commercial data catalogue.     Administer CDM activities related to the sales operations quarterly cycle.     Maintain requirements documents, business rules and metadata.     Provide first-level support for data inquiries.     Provide ad-hoc support to CDM colleagues.     Refresh Existing Reports and identifies improvement opportunities in reporting and BI tools and as needed structure / functionality with the latest insights as they become available.     Collaborates with Digital to enhance data access across various sources, develop tools, technology, and process to constantly improve quality and productivity.           Process:       Support delivery of projects in terms of resourcing, coordination, quality, timeliness, efficiency, and high technical standards for deliveries made by the CMD Team.     Contribute to overall quality enhancement by ensuring high standards for the output produced by the medical/ field writing group; and     Secure adherence to compliance procedures and internal/operational risk controls in accordance with all applicable standards     Refresh report on frequency/cycle basis (weekly / monthly / quarterly / annually) ,  along with QC checks for each refresh                   Stakeholder:    Work closely with global teams and/ external vendors to ensure the end-to-end effective project delivery of the designated publication/medical education deliverables                 About you               Experience   :     5+ years of experience in US pharmaceutical commercial and omni channel data, data governance and data stewardship. In-depth knowledge of common databases like IQVIA, DHC, DDD, Xponent, One Key, Symphony, APLD, SFMC, Omnichannel, Sales Engagement and execution data, etc.            Soft skills   : Strong learning agility; Ability to manage ambiguous environments, and to adapt to changing needs of the business; Good interpersonal and communication skills; strong presentation skills a must; Team player who is curious, dynamic, result oriented and can work collaboratively; Ability to think strategically in an ambiguous environment; Ability to operate effectively in an international matrix environment, with ability to work across time zones; Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques        Technical skills   :     Bachelor s degree from an accredited four-year college or university      At least 3+ years direct experience with pharmaceutical sales data and data management with the emphasis on syndicated data, Specialty Pharmacy and digital/multi-channel data      Strong working understanding in Pharma MDMs      Experience in customer data management, HCP/HCP Affiliation      Strong knowledge of pharmaceutical sales and marketing data sources ( IQVIA, DHC, DDD, Xponent, One Key, Symphony, APLD, SFMC, Omnichannel, Sales Engagement and execution data, etc )      Understanding in key commercial operations such as CRM, Field Deployment, Digital Channel Marketing, Incentive Compensation, Call Planning, BI & Analytica. Etc     Knowledge of and/or experience in pharmaceuticals sales operations; understands how data is applied in a pharmaceutical s commercial operations context      Ability to translate business needs into data requirement      Understands the basic principles of data management and data processing for commercial pharma business      Understands the basic principles of data governance and date stewardship (data quality).      At least 3-4 years direct experience with pharmaceutical commercial data with the emphasis on customer data.      At least 3-4 years experience in pharma commercial business process and data operations.      Experience in Reltio      Proficient of Excel/word/powerpoint.      An aptitude for problem solving and strategic thinking and ensuring high quality data output with strong quality assurance      Ability to synthesize complex information into clear and actionable insights      Proven ability to work effectively across all levels of stakeholders and diverse functions      Solid understanding of pharmaceutical development, manufacturing, supply chain and marketing functions      Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques      Effectively collaborate across differing levels of management, functions and role      Strong decision-making skills, identifying key issues, developing solutions and gaining commitment            Education   : Advanced degree in areas such as Management/Statistics/Decision Sciences/Engineering/Life Sciences/ Business Analytics or related field (e.g., PhD / MBA / Masters)        Languages   : Excellent knowledge in English and strong communication skills - written and spoken
column11: Supply chain, Business process, Manager Quality Assurance, Data management, Pharma, Business analytics, Data processing, Life sciences, CRM, Business operations

column2: Database Management: Design, implement, and maintain Microsoft SQL Server databases, ensuring optimal performance, security, and availability.     Performance Tuning: Monitor and tune database performance by analyzing query execution plans, optimizing indexes, and configuring server settings.     Backup and Recovery: Develop and implement backup and recovery strategies to protect the integrity and availability of data, including regular data backups, restoration, and disaster recovery planning.     Security Management: Implement and maintain database security protocols, including user access controls, data encryption, and data masking, to protect sensitive information.     Database Monitoring: Monitor and troubleshoot database issues, identify performance bottlenecks, and proactively take corrective actions to ensure continuous system availability.     Capacity Planning: Analyze database growth patterns and forecast future database capacity requirements, recommending appropriate hardware and software upgrades to support business needs.     Database Documentation: Create and maintain technical documentation, including database schemas, configurations, and operational procedures, to ensure accurate system knowledge transfer and compliance.     Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and network engineers, to support application development, deployment, and integration efforts.     Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in database management, recommending and implementing process enhancements and automation to improve operational efficiency.     Troubleshooting and Support: Respond to and resolve database-related incidents and service requests, providing timely and effective support to internal stakeholders.       Requirements:       Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).     Proven experience as a Microsoft SQL Server DBA, managing enterprise-level database systems.     Strong knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, including database design, administration, performance tuning, and troubleshooting.     Experience with database backup and recovery strategies, including disaster recovery planning and implementation.     Proficiency in SQL programming and scripting languages.     Familiarity with database security concepts and best practices.     Understanding of high availability (HA) and failover clustering technologies.     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex database issues.     Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously.     Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.       Preferred Qualifications:       Microsoft SQL Server certification (eg, MCSA, MCSE) or equivalent industry certifications.     Experience with cloud-based database platforms, such as Microsoft Azure SQL Database.     Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and technologies.     Knowledge of PowerShell or other automation tools for database administration tasks.     Experience with performance monitoring and tuning tools, such as SQL Server Profiler or Extended Events.
column11: SQL Server Database Administrator, SAN, Performance tuning, Database design, MySQL, Application development, Oracle, Open source, MCSE, Information technology

column2: Responsible for re-building, maintaining and managing Future Planning tools and reports including, program budgets, data roll ups, growth projection files, inventory management tracking files, and capacity management files     The successful candidate will also provide analysis and actionable reports of Conference Production future planning data to aid senior leadership decision making                 What you will do:            Design and build from start to finish complex analytic models and tools to support the global team, utilizing advanced modelling, Excel, and VBA skills.     Rebuild growth projection model in-line with our business-wide priorities to effectively manage our projected conference growth for long term planning purposes. Automating and streamlining our current processes, whilst taking direction to build a source of truth that reflects similar models across the business.     Build, manage, and continuously improve all planning documents and associated roll ups, critical for managing various functions across the Conferences Future Planning team. Including over 250 complex and cross-linked files at any given time in Microsoft Excel.     Create automations and efficiencies across various planning documents that are widely used across multi-functional teams.     Proactively identify opportunities to automate processes, mapping out project plans to drive document improvement and connections. Use advanced VBA programming to automate manual Excel processes to realize significant time savings and reduction in errors.     Partner with stakeholders and other team members to identify data analytics requirements. Identify and implement most effective and efficient solutions.     Support global team, building conference planning tools from scratch, including problem solving the most effective solutions and training team as required, enabling production team to efficiently analyze large amounts of data make crucial event planning decisions.               What you will need:             Experience:    6+ years of progressive business experience, preferably in a strategy, consulting or business operations role.       Qualifications Education:    Bachelor s degree and advanced training in Microsoft Excel is preferred.       Technical skills:    Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel including VBA, with the ability to create and interpret complex Excel reports to track past, present, and future conference data and determine how to represent this in a dashboard. Experience of SharePoint and its capabilities is desirable, but not required. Ability to identify opportunities to automate processes using smart technology and quickly master any new software needed to build the models and tools required to take projects to the next level.       Soft skills:    Exceptional problem-solving capability, you have a proven track record of solving complex problems, thinking creatively, and using data to tell a story and drive change. Detail oriented, you have a critical eye for details and can effectively analyze and summarize data. Fast-paced, you operate with a sense of urgency and can excel in an execution-focused environment. You have a demonstrated ability to own a problem and aggressively drive from problem statement to solution in a self-sufficient capacity, even in a matrixed environment.       Communication skills:    You are an excellent and structured verbal and written communicator. It is essential that you can work alongside a team whose technical skills and knowledge is organically learned and can translate directions and results in a digestible manor.       Strong core values:    You demonstrate integrity, collaboration, a no-limits mindset, objectivity, and consistent results using global best practices.       Personality traits:    Proactively demonstrate open-mindedness to contextualize all projects in their real-life scenarios, through building an understanding and knowledge of the conferences business. Being customer-centric is pivotal to our expectations of delivering seamless onsite experiences. This role will include travel and onsite conference delivery.             What you will get:          Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!     Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)     Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity      Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities
column11: Capacity management, Excel, Data management, VBA, HR, Medical insurance, Event planning, Team building, Recruitment, Business operations

column2: Experience Mid-Level (5+ years)       Minimum Qualifications:       Design, develop, deploy, and maintain enterprise logging platform using ELK and Kafka technologies.     Extensive experience with Apache Kafka or Confluent Kafka and AWS. MSK.     Manage large scale multi-nodes Kafka and ELK cluster environments residing on AWS OpenSearch and On-premises.     Handle all Kafka environment builds and upgrades including design, capacity planning, cluster setup, performance tuning, connectors, and ongoing monitoring.     Perform high-level, day-to-day operational maintenance, support, and upgrades for the Kafka and ELK clusters.       Day to day        Kafka administration such as topic creation, altering topic configurations, rebalancing partitions, and checking overall Kafka cluster health.     Great exposure working to Kafka Connectors and bridges, this     includes the ability to set them up as well as support them.     Familiar with Confluent Control Center.     Experience working with encryption both in transit and at rest and setting up SSL/TLS for Kafka and ELK.     Ability to setup Zookeeper and administrate the Zookeeper CLI.     Experience in setting up ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana stack) to process data from multiple data sources including Kafka and     IBM Frameworks     Contribute to design and architectural tradeoffs including Scalability,     Resiliency, High Availability and Security Perform capacity planning and solution review related to Kafka and ELK environments.     Work with data log streaming platforms and tools to ingest data from systems, applications, and access logs.     Investigate emerging Elastic advancements that relate to our customers needs and implement those upgrades.     Extensive experience with Elasticsearch index configuration options, shards, aliases, etc.     Experience with Elastic API Integration.       Day to day        ELK administration such as rebalancing, shard maintenance, user creation, role creation and Kibana security.     Comfortable working with Unix/Linux based Operating System.     Capable of writing automation scripts in both Python and Bash Shell.     Design and develop monitoring solutions including the ability to work with monitoring and alerting tools such as Grafana, Datadog and Prometheus.     Process automation and new application on-boarding, integration with CICD pipeline.     Fluent with CloudFormation or Terraform, preferably CloudFormation as we are an AWS shop.     Big plus, previous experience with Docket and Kubernetes setup and administration.

column2: As a MySQL Database Administrator (DBA), you will be responsible for maintaining, optimizing, and ensuring the availability and performance of our MySQL database systems      Your role will involve implementing best practices, monitoring database performance, performing backups, and troubleshooting issues      You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to support application development and ensure data integrity and security        Responsibilities:        Database Management:Install, configure, and upgrade MySQL database software and related tools      Monitor database performance, availability, and resource utilization to ensure optimal performance      Perform regular database maintenance tasks, such as backups, recovery, and schema changes      Performance Optimization:Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks and database-related issues      Optimize queries, indexes, and database configuration settings for improved performance      Implement caching mechanisms and other performance-enhancing techniques      Security and Compliance:Implement and maintain database security measures, including access controls and encryption      Ensure compliance with data protection and privacy regulations      Monitor and audit database activity to detect and address security vulnerabilities      High Availability and Disaster Recovery:Configure and manage database replication, clustering, and failover mechanisms for high availability      Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans and conduct regular testing      Backup and Recovery:Design and implement backup and recovery strategies to safeguard data against loss      Perform regular backup operations and test restoration procedures      Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution:Investigate and troubleshoot database-related issues, such as performance slowdowns, errors, and crashes      Collaborate with development and infrastructure teams to identify root causes and implement solutions      Automation and Scripting:Develop and maintain scripts for database monitoring, maintenance, and automation      Implement tools and processes to streamline repetitive tasks      Documentation and Reporting:Maintain documentation for database configurations, procedures, and best practices      Provide regular status reports on database performance and health      Collaboration and Communication:Work closely with development teams to support application deployment and ensure database compatibility      Collaborate with system administrators and network engineers to optimize overall system performance
