column2: As Manager, Vendor Master Data you will be responsible for oversight and execution of day-to-day operations of Vendor Master Data Governance on a global scale.              You will design and manage data workflows, as well as drive robust data quality and compliance with internal and external data regulations, policies, and procedures (GXP, SOX, PII).              Your work will play a key role in supporting the Kenvue Operations organization and Digital Transformation                        Key Responsibilities                          Govern key data processes, core master and operational data, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and policies        Implement and continuously optimize global Vendor Master Data processes, in partnership with cross-functional teams      Act as the single point of contact for vendor-related data and processes      Monitor, analyze and communicate data quality, identify gaps, and make recommendations to improve data quality      Lead data issue resolution efforts, partnering with cross-functional business process owners and data stewards to remediate data quality errors and build sustainable processes to drive high levels of data quality      Own documentation such as business process diagrams, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, etc.      Be responsible for audit compliance, including data records are thoroughly maintained in preparation for audits following established processes and protocols      Support vendor related projects across IT and business functions; ensure integration across systems / platform and lead data cleansing, creation, conversion and validation as required      Drive data quality and operational excellence through intelligent automation initiatives      Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on processes, procedures, data flows, etc.      May include people leadership responsibilities, such as leading, developing, and retaining talent through coaching, mentorship, and development planning                    Qualifications                              What We Are Looking For                  Required Qualifications                      Bachelor s degree in business, data analytics / technology or related field; advance degree preferred        Minimum 12-15 years of experience with at least 5 years of experience in supply chain, finance, data analytics / technology, or other relevant function      At least 3 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms      Procurement and finance functional knowledge added advantage      Experience managing data related to direct vendors, indirect vendors, affiliates, and/or third parties      Business and technical knowledge and understanding of procurement-related data elements and processes      Ability to build strong collaborative relationships and influence diverse stakeholders in support of expected outcomes      Demonstrated experience embedding a culture of harmonization, process improvement, and value creation across functions, departments, and/or regions      Knowledge of data governance, data quality, and compliance requirements (e.g., GXP, SOX, PII)      Strong Excel skills and ability to leverage data visualization tools (e.g., PowerBI) to generate insights            Desired Qualifications                              Experience working with SAP S4 Hana and/or SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) is preferred                      Demonstrated experience implementing and/or managing global ERP systems is preferred                      Experience working in or leading global, geographically dispersed teams is preferred                      Experience working across Finance and Supply Chain domains (e.g., procurement, planning, etc.) is preferred                      Experience working within Consumer-Packaged Goods sector is preferred

column2: The Data Management & Governance specialist must be the big-picture thinker who understands the value of data to the organization and the importance of good information management practices including information lifecycle management, information modelling, master data management and business requirements gathering     In this position, you are responsible for improving business performance and cost optimization through the use of business glossaries, information models, repositories and flows to meet the requirements of the business strategies and business processes           Responsibilities    You will work on various aspects of Data management and governance including but not limited to:       Driving and taking the lead in identifying information value opportunities through strategic discussions with Senior Business and IT Leaders as needed and provides decision support     Acting as the Informatics representative to define Information and Data Strategies as part of an overall Business Strategy.     Identifying areas for improvement in terms of information flows and structure, automation, information representation and advising project teams in best practice and implementation     Improving the overall quality of the enterprise data assets through the effective application of best practice in information design     Backlog Management: Prioritise and maintain the product backlog, making continuous adjustments to reflect changing priorities and market dynamics.     Transform requirements into detailed user stories, acceptance criteria, and mockups that guide the development process.     Following up on the resolution of Incidents (e.g. maintaining the customer informed).     Assessment of changes.     Support the Product Manager to make informed decisions on product features, priorities, feedback, and business goals.     Coordinate and plan product releases, ensuring alignment with business goals, technical feasibility, and quality standards.     Documentation review and approval.     Translating business requirements into system requirements.     Assisting the Business with data management activities.             The ideal candidate         Is principally focused on enterprise information solutions, such as master data management, metadata management, business intelligence, data interoperability, data analysis, data quality, data integration.     Understands Data Mesh paradigm     Encourages a data citizenship mindset ensuring we all collectively take responsibility and accountability for the data we create, consume, manage and share.     Exhibits an Agile mindset     Understands database structures and their relationships, as well as data models and data standards.     Ability to create advanced SQL queries.     Ability to work with REST APIs through tools such as Postman.     Familiarity with Backlog and Service Management tools (e.g. JIRA, ServiceNow, HP ALM).     Has the ability to escalate and drive management decisions in relation to project execution     3+ years of data strategy and data governance, preferably in a consulting environment.     Bachelor s Degree with strong data understanding through experience

column2: The purpose of this role is to deliver database services within IT Services providing DBA expertise, and 24x7 support to all services leveraging database technologies hosted on premise and Azure.     The job holder will ensure the successful delivery of database services as a coherent and proactive practice across all services, guaranteeing it is not considered as a check box exercise , while interacting with Application, Development and Operational teams.       Key Deliverables/Responsibilities         The DBA is responsible for the following activities:     Perform operational DBA duties, including installation, database upgrades, patching, environment cloning, implementing backup/recovery and monitoring procedures, capacity planning, and performance tuning and site failover.     Design, architect, build SQL Server Oracle platforms determining business requirements to planning and deploying test and production systems.     Interface with application development teams to resolve problems with application/database systems.     Take part to 24/7/365 operations in a business-critical environment.     Must be comfortable working with global teams and multi-cultural environment.     Manage multiple applications or service areas and projects simultaneously to ensure on- time response, quality delivery and resolutions.     Support continues improvement through optimizations and automation of the systems and processes for existing and new database services.         Experience Required         Essential Technical Requirements         Minimum 8-10 years of related experience     Significant knowledge of SQL Server on-premises and Azure SQL services, this will be your passion and you will be required to get under the bonnet of a live system, coming up with innovative solutions.     Good working knowledge with Oracle database technology on Windows and Linux platforms.     Good understanding of Oracle backup and recovery RMAN/Data pump     Good working knowledge of High Availability technologies i.e., SQL Failover Clusters Availability Groups     Have worked for at least 5 years in a 24/7 environment.     Strong understanding of relational database architecture concepts     Strong performance tuning and troubleshooting skills.     Excellent written and verbal communication skills.     Strong hands-on experience administering large, high volume 24/7 SQL and Oracle platforms.Experience in implementing and managing databases in complex enterprise environments, with business application and third-party products, solutions, and technologies.     Ability to handle multiple deliverables, both scheduled and unscheduled, like deployments, builds, scheduled batch activities or jobs, issue/incident management, problem management, etc.     Ability to communicate technical issues to stakeholders as well as to communicate business drivers to engineers.     Proven analytical abilities and using data/facts for decision-making.     Good working knowledge of database technologies leveraging IaaS PaaS.     Desirable Skills: Azure PaaS (SQL DB Managed Instance), T-SQL, SSIS package deployment     Competencies specific for this role:     Four years university degree or college diploma in the field of computer science and/or 6 years equivalent work experience.     Good understanding of ITIL Service Management.     Possess the necessary formal presentation skills, and excellent work ethic.     Experience and understanding of risk management and risk mitigation activities.         Behavioural Competencies         Proven experience of delivering process efficiencies and improvements     Clear and fluent English (both verbal and written)     Ability to build and maintain efficient working relationships with remote teams     Demonstrate ability to take ownership of and accountability for relevant products and services     Ability to plan, prioritise and complete your own work, whilst remaining a team player     Willingness to engage with and work in other technologies

column2: Role & responsibilities   Position: Database Site Reliability Engineer - SRE. Work Location: Bengaluru. Job Summary:  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Database Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our dynamic team. This role is crucial for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our data management systems to support our organization's data-driven decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data modeling, database optimization, data governance, and collaboration with cross-functional teams. Key Responsibilities:  (Note: This is not a conventional DBA role which is focused purely on operations.)  Data Modelling and Design :  Develop and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models.  Create blueprints for data management systems to integrate, centralize, protect, and maintain data sources.  Define and design data structures (DDL) for tables and indexing, including technology-specific features.  Collaborate with software development teams, providing guidance for solutions, changes, and CI/CD releases.  CI/CD and Cloud Technologies:  Develop CI/CD components to assist software development with logical database changes.  Design data structures with AWS technologies like Oracle/PostgreSQL RDS, DynamoDB, and Redshift.  Design, build, and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) components with tools such as Terraform, Chef, Git, and Jenkins.  Database Optimization:  Implement database solutions that optimize performance, scalability, and reliability.  Conduct SQL profiling, implement table/index partitioning, and workload management mechanisms.  Review and guide on database procedural language objects for efficiency and security.  Data Governance and Quality:  Establish data governance policies and procedures for data integrity and compliance.  Monitor data quality and implement improvements as necessary.  Collaboration and Communication:  Work closely with IT teams, management, and other stakeholders to identify and meet data requirements.  Translate business needs into technical specifications.  Database Security:  Implement and manage security measures for data protection.  Ensure compliance with data privacy laws and CSG security standards.  Provide guidance and implement security fixes for database components.  Troubleshooting and Maintenance:  Provide support for existing databases and resolve complex issues.  Lead database version upgrade projects and implement cloud provider recommendations.  Emerging Technologies:  Stay abreast of new trends and technologies in data architecture and database management.  Continuously improve skills in coding, development, and design with a focus on Python, SQL Tools, and Cloud Applications.  Required Qualifications:  Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field.  Proven experience as a Database Administrator, Database Engineer, or similar role, with a focus on site reliability engineering principles.  Strong knowledge of relational and non-relational database systems (e.g., Oracle , MySQL, PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Cassandra).  Strong experience with SQL and Database procedural languages.  Experience with cloud services (AWS, GCP, Azure) and understanding of cloud-based database management.  Familiarity with database monitoring tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) and automation tools (e.g., Ansible, Terraform).  Proficient in scripting languages (e.g., Jenkins, Python, Bash) for automation.  Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.  Strong communication skills, both written and verbal .

Ability to interface and obtain strong working knowledge of portfolio of deals and accounts. column1: Associate, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis I
column2: The US Quants Team interacts with various teams on a day-to-day basis, primarily the Client Team and Portfolio Managers and is often the conduit between various teams/workflows. These teams often rely on the Quant Team to provide analysis which will be delivered to clients and impact trading decisions. The team is also expecting significant growth in the coming years and so are looking for highly skilled, detail-oriented and motivated candidates to support its growing business.         This will be an individual contributor role. The analyst will be expected to provide quantitative support across a number of areas including investment and pension liability modelling, solution design, portfolio monitoring, risk and performance analysis.         The analyst will also be expected to support day to day processes such as maintaining custom liability benchmarks, preparing bespoke client reports, developing/ enhancing existing tools (Excel/ Python) etc.           To be successful in this role, we re seeking the following:            3 - 5 years work experience in a similar or related role with a top tier firm. Example roles include as a quant developer/programmer, data scientist, investment quant and/or fixed income/derivative analysis within financial services, investment bank, asset manager, or consulting firm.         The candidate will require a high level of quantitative and computational financial skill and ability to solve extremely complex problems for our US LDI clients. They will ideally hold a primary degree in a quantitative science with experience in programming. They will preferably have additional quant-orientated qualifications or progress towards investment designation (e.g., CFA).          Ideal candidates would have strong work experience and relevant knowledge/skill in a number of the following areas:         Sound programming knowledge with relevant on-the-job experience         Understanding of present value calculations, interest rate and credit spread risk         Familiarity with fixed income, derivative markets and hedging techniques         Ability and desire to apply numerical skills in the workplace. Candidate with mathematics, statistics, or engineering background is preferred.         Ability to work in a highly collaborative team environment. Candidate will need to work with US and Pune team members simultaneously.         Understanding of US Pensions and related risk management techniques is a plus         The candidate should have strong verbal and written communication as they will need to articulate their thought process in any given task and set these out via email/messaging or video call. The candidate should be fluent in English and is expected to work closely with US and Pune team members. They should be deadline driven, have a strong work ethic and be committed to meet the deadlines.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams including project managers, developers, system administrators, and business stakeholders to ensure successful planning and execution of the upgrade and migration project.         Conduct a thorough assessment of the current EBS environment and develop a detailed upgrade and migration strategy.         Perform pre-upgrade tasks such as database health checks, patching, and compatibility assessments to ensure a smooth transition.         Configure and optimize OCI infrastructure components such as compute instances, storage, networking, and security for hosting EBS.         Implement Oracle EBS upgrades, applying necessary patches, fixes, and updates in accordance with Oracle s best practices and guidelines.         Ensure data integrity and consistency throughout the migration process, conducting validation testsand troubleshooting any issues that arise.         Document all upgrade and migration procedures, configurations, and troubleshooting steps for future reference and knowledge sharing.         Provide post-migration support and assistance to users, addressing any performance issues, system errors, or configuration issues that may arise.         Proactively monitor the upgraded EBS environment on OCI, identifying and resolving any performance bottlenecks or security vulnerabilities.         Collaborate with Oracle Support as needed to troubleshoot complex technical issues and escalate critical problems.         Requirement:         Proven experience in leading and executing EBS upgrade and migration projects, preferably to OCI.         In-depth knowledge of Oracle E-Business Suite architecture, components, and modules.         Hands-on experience with Oracle EBS migration, installation, configuration, and administration.         Strong experience in EBS application and database upgrade to latest version 12.2. with 19C         Proficiency in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) services and components, with experience in deploying and managing EBS on OCI.         Strong understanding of database performance tuning, troubleshooting, and optimization techniques.         Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues.         Effective communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.         Oracle certifications such as Oracle Certified Professional (OCP) or Oracle Certified Expert (OCE) in Oracle E-Business Suite and Oracle Database are a plus.         Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.         Willingness to learn new technologies and stay updated with the latest trends in Oracle E-Business Suite and cloud computing.

Performance Tuning and Monitoring: Analyze and optimize database performance using  Oracle database wait events. Monitor system performance and capacity planning. column2: Job Description: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Oracle Apps DBA to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for installation, configuration, upgrading, and maintenance of the Oracle server software and related products. The role will also involve working collaboratively as part of a team to provide 24x7 support when required.  Responsibilities:   ??Install, configure, and upgrade Oracle server software and related products. ??Monitor and maintain application-related products like oa core, oafm Apache, etc. ??Establish and maintain backup and recovery policies and procedures. ??Design and implement the database. ??Implement and maintain database security, create and maintain users and roles, and assign privileges. ??Perform general technical troubleshooting and provide consultation to development teams. ??Interface with Oracle Corporation for technical support. ??Manage patch management and version control. ??Perform database tuning and performance monitoring. ??Perform backup & recovery, administration, application tuning, and performance monitoring and troubleshoot. ??Clone DEV and TEST from PROD in on-premise and cloud environments. ??Perform front end application user maintenance and sysadmin activities. ??Work with Oracle EBS 12.2.x and Oracle Database 11g/12c. ??Manage & pro-actively monitor using OEM 12c/13c. ??Familiarity with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. ??Migrate EBS & DB from on-premise to cloud (preferably Oracle). ??Have hands-on experience with Oracle RAC & multitenant databases. ??Possess PL/SQL scripting knowledge, which will be an added advantage Personal Attributes: ??Self-driven team player able to work collaboratively. ??Excellent Communication Skills. ??Flexibility, strong commitment to quality work, and continuous improvement. About Company : INFOLOB Global Inc. is a prosperous information technology consulting organization dedicated to customer satisfaction via flawless digital transformation and admirable managed services. Established in 2009, Infolob is one-stop-shop for all Oracle technologies with specialties across cloud migration and infrastructure management, multi- and hybrid-cloud enablement, Oracle Fusion Apps, cloud security, Oracle Engineered Systems, and database management. The Texas-headquartered company also has branches in Hyderabad and Chennai in India and the Internet City in Dubai. Infolob holds 18 Oracle Expertise Certifications and its nearly half of its approximately 300 workforce strengths are Oracle certified professionals across 53 technologies. The ISO 9001-2015 certified company has won Oracle Most Valuable Partner award for Exadata in 2018, 2019, and 2020, and has a seat in the Oracle Exadata Advisory Board

column2: An Oracle Core DBA (Database Administrator) is a professional responsible for the installation, configuration, maintenance, and optimization of Oracle Database systems      They play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation and performance of Oracle databases within an organization      Here are some key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with an Oracle Core DBA:Database Installation and Configuration: Oracle Core DBAs install and configure Oracle Database software on servers or systems      They ensure proper setup, including configuring database parameters, creating database instances, and establishing connections to client applications      Database Maintenance and Monitoring: DBAs perform regular maintenance tasks, such as database backups, recovery, and applying patches or updates      They monitor database performance, identify bottlenecks or issues, and take corrective actions to optimize performance and ensure high availability      Database Security and User Management: DBAs implement and maintain database security measures, including user authentication, role-based access control, and data encryption      They manage database users, roles, and privileges, ensuring that access is granted according to the organization's security policies      Database Performance Tuning: DBAs analyze and optimize database performance by monitoring and fine-tuning various aspects of the database, such as query optimization, index creation, and memory management      They use performance monitoring tools and techniques to identify and resolve performance bottlenecks      Backup and Recovery: DBAs implement and manage database backup and recovery strategies to protect critical data      They design backup plans, perform regular backups, and test the restore processes to ensure data integrity and minimize downtime in case of failures or disasters
column11: Performance tuning, query optimization, Monitoring tools, Memory management, database security, data integrity, Database maintenance, Database Administrator, User management, Performance monitoring

column2: Your responsibility as a MySQL database administrator (DBA) will be the performance, integrity and security of a database     Youll be involved in the planning and development of the database, as well as in troubleshooting any issues on behalf of the users                 You'll ensure that :             - Data remains consistent across the database, data is clearly defined           - Users access data concurrently, in a form that suits their needs           - There is provision for data security and recovery control (ensuring all data is retrievable in an emergency).             As a database administrator, youll need to :             - Establish the needs of users and monitor user access and security, monitor performance and manage parameters in order to provide fast responses to front-end users           - Map out the conceptual design for a planned database           - Consider both back-end organization of data and front-end accessibility for end-users           - Refine the logical design so that it can be translated into a specific data model           - Further refining the physical design to meet system storage requirements.           - Install and test new versions of the database management system (DBMS)           - Maintain data standards, including adherence to the Data Protection Act           - Write database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata)           - Control access permissions and privileges           - Develop, manage and test back-up and recovery plans           - Ensure that storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly and carry out capacity planning           - Work closely with IT project managers, database programmers and multimedia programmers.           - Communicate regularly with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security           - Commission and install new applications and customize existing applications in order to make them fit for the purpose           - Reverse db migrations           - Manage the security and disaster recovery aspects of a database.             Why join us                    A collaborative output driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology                  Improve the average revenue per use by increasing the cross-sell opportunities                 A solid 360 feedbacks from your peer teams on your support of their goals                 Respect, that is earned, not demanded from your peers and manager

column2: A Cassandra DBA (Database Administrator) is responsible for the administration, maintenance, and optimization of Cassandra databases within an organization      They play a crucial role in ensuring the availability, performance, and scalability of the Cassandra database environment      Here is a general job description for a Cassandra DBA:        Responsibilities:        Database Administration: Install, configure, and maintain Cassandra database clusters in both development and production environments      Manage database schemas, tables, indexes, and user permissions      Perform database backups, recovery, and restoration activities      Performance Monitoring and Tuning: Monitor the performance and health of Cassandra clusters      Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, slow queries, and resource utilization issues      Optimize database configurations, query performance, and data modeling for improved efficiency and scalability      Capacity Planning: Monitor database growth and plan for future capacity needs      Estimate storage requirements and work with infrastructure teams to ensure adequate resources are provisioned      Scale up or scale out the database infrastructure as needed to accommodate data growth      Data Replication and High Availability: Configure and manage Cassandra replication strategies to ensure data availability and durability      Implement data replication across multiple data centers and handle replication challenges, such as consistency and latency      Security and Access Control: Implement and enforce database security measures, including authentication, authorization, and encryption      Set up user roles and permissions to control access to databases and data      Regularly review and update security configurations to address emerging threats and vulnerabilities      Database Monitoring and Alerting: Set up database monitoring tools to proactively identify performance issues, errors, and anomalies      Create and configure alerts to notify relevant teams of critical database events      Respond to database alerts and take appropriate actions to resolve issues

column2: KeySkills:           ORACLE DATA INTEGRATION, ORACLE DATA INTEGRATION SUITE, ORACLE DATA INTEGRATION SUITE, ORACLE DATA INTEGRATOR (ODI), ORACLE GOLDEN GATE, ORACLE DATA QUALITY, DATA MODELING, ETL PROCESSES, ETL DEVELOPMENT, DESIGNING, IMPLEMENTING COMPLEX ETL MAPPINGS, WORKFLOWS, SQL, PL/SQL, DATA GOVERNANCE, INTEGRITY, ACCURACY, DATA WAREHOUSES, MONITOR, TROUBLESHOOT, SLAS (SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENTS), DATA INTEGRATION PROCESSES, DATA MAPPINGS, TRANSFORMATION RULES, WORKFLOW DIAGRAMS                   JOB SUMMARY:               We are seeking a highly skilled Oracle Data Integration Specialist to join our team.         The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining data integration solutions using Oracle Data Integration technologies.         They will collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and develop efficient data integration solutions that meet business needs.         The candidate should have a strong background in Oracle Data Integration Suite and related technologies, as well as experience in data modeling, ETL processes, and data governance best practices.                 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:                 Design, develop, and implement data integration solutions using Oracle Data Integration Suite, including Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Oracle Golden Gate, and Oracle Data Quality.         Collaborate with business stakeholders and data analysts to understand data integration requirements and translate them into technical specifications.         Perform data analysis and data modeling to ensure the integrity, accuracy, and performance of data integration processes.         Develop ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) mappings, workflows, and scripts to extract data from source systems, transform it according to business rules, and load it into target databases or data warehouses.         Optimize data integration processes for performance, scalability, and reliability.         Monitor and troubleshoot data integration jobs to ensure they run successfully and meet SLAs (Service Level Agreements).         Develop and maintain documentation for data integration processes, including data mappings, transformation rules, and workflow diagrams.         Collaborate with database administrators and system administrators to deploy and configure data integration solutions in various environments.         Stay current with Oracle Data Integration technologies and industry best practices, and make recommendations for process improvements and tool enhancements.         Provide training and technical guidance to junior team members as needed.               JOB DESCRIPTION:               Proficiency in Oracle Data Integration Suite, including Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Oracle Golden Gate, and Oracle Data Quality.         Strong understanding of data modeling concepts and techniques.         Experience with ETL development, including designing and implementing complex ETL mappings and workflows.         Familiarity with SQL and PL/SQL programming languages.         Knowledge of data governance principles and best practices.         Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.         Strong communication and collaboration skills.         Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently         Oracle certifications (e.g., Oracle Data Integrator Certified Implementation Specialist) are a plus.

column2: The MDM System Administrator owns the day-to-day management of the SAP MDG platform including being an expert a    t configuring the MDG platform itself, data modeling, business rules, and the front-end user experience    .                  This role will maintain MDG workflows, data integrations, and typical administrative duties including users maintenance, training, and liaising with the business on process changes/updates.                  The administrator will support Global Data Governance through the use of the MDG technology helping to ensure clean accurate data through the platform and monitoring data quality.                        Responsibilities                              Administers                the maintenance, configuration, and reliable operation of the SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) Platform.                                          Researches, coordinates and installs software releases and database integration to ensure no business interruption in meeting our operational requirements.                                  Ensures master data integrity in MDG platform as well as maintaining the processes to support the data quality.                                Trains data stewards and key stakeholders on maintaining master data records                                Develops data quality tracking KPI s within MDM to ensure high data quality.                                  Identifies areas for data quality improvements and helps to resolve data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies.                                  In collaboration with subject matter experts and data stewards, defines and implements data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure the enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.                                  Work closely with the business/IT to ensure alignment of master data rules and the operations of the application meet all requirements.                                  Assists in the application and implementation procedures of data standards and guidelines on data ownership, coding structures, and data replication to ensure access to and integrity of data sets.                                Specific Experience / Education / Certification Requirements      (Knowledge & Experience; Qualifications):                    Required                          Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, a related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience.                          Min 2-3 years experience with SAP s MDG required.                          Understanding of SAP ECC and or S4/ HANA preferred                          Experience with master data management processes and technology including developing data models and maintaining master data records within SAP MDG                          Strong communication skills (verbal and written) and presentation skills.                          Detail-oriented, organized, and capable of prioritizing workload to complete multiple tasks while meeting aggressive deadlines                          Work independently with minimal supervision                              Desired                                  Experience working with Global teams                              Experience in operating in and Agile environment                      Knowledge in REST/SOAP architectural principles and patterns with API/JSON, XML experience.                    BAPI/BADI, SAP (ABAP) Workflow, SAP BRF+, SAP Floorplan Manager (UI), and or SAP Configuration Workbench.

column2: Role purpose:   Working for Business Intelligence requires a good understanding of the business context and the business requirements. Focus of the role is development and maintenance of BI Application Layer which is the Semantic layer and direct interface to our BI customers in close collaboration with multidisciplinary team in other BICC and IT departments. Major focus is backend development for this layer, which means, responsible for the development of required data structures, data marts, massaging of the data and their transfer into regular service operation. Within BI Laboratory Approach role could be responsible for the development of ETLs from source systems into the Data Warehouse, as well as for creating a consistent data base. BI-LAB means a system, an application, a database for trials, experiments, tests investigations, etc. in BICC responsibilities. BI Lab environments might be delivering data and information for a regular business workflow but their own technical basis is still in a pre-operational phase. It helps to stabilise, specify unclear and fast changing business requirements in an agile and encapsulated environment.  Our BI major task and activities are organised in the 3 processes Demand Fulfilment Process (DeFuP) BI Service Operation Process (BISOP) Service Support Process (SeSuP) Assistance of DeFuP by participating on different projects, lager programs, or small requests will be emphasis of regular work. Support of BISOP and SeSuP in particular in case of critical issues and problem analysis are required as well.   Outputs described below. Data Preparation for Data Marts and BI   Applications. Develop & maintain (3rd level support) PL/SQL scripts   to prepare and provide data for BI Application Layer. Fixing problems in cooperation with internal and external partners   (e.g. Service owner, Tech. Support Team, IT-Ops) Designing and implementing changes to the existing   data model Develop & maintain relational staging areas of   BI Application Layer Supporting operations team on data quality, data   consistency issues and essential business critical processes  Conducting preventative maintenance of the systems Drive system optimization and simplification Responsible for performance of data on BI   Application Layer and optimisation of the data preparation in conjunction   with the reporting team/tool Supporting business users in system handling and   optimizing.   Essential  3-7   years strong BI and Data Warehouse development experience Strong SQL experience - Advanced level of PL/SQL   (Oracle) scripting.  Excellent   data interpretation skills Good knowledge of data warehouse and a   business intelligence, good understanding of range of data manipulation and   analysis techniques Working knowledge of large information   technology development projects using methodologies and standards Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal   communication skills, demonstrating the ability to communicate information   technology concepts to non-technology personnel, should be able to interact   with client team and share ideas. Strong   analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills, attitude to plan and   organize work to deliver as agreed Ability   to work under pressure to tight deadlines. Hands   on experience working with large datasets    Desired Oracle DB configuration management and/or   DBA activities Oracle   ODI programming Good skills in Microsoft Excel incl.   VBA/Macro Good knowledge of Unix/Linux command line Basic understanding of Unix shell scripting Basic understanding of SAS scripting  Telecommunication experience

column2: Become a Data Guardian: Senior Data Governance Analyst with Azure Purview & Databricks! Are you a passionate data governance champion with a keen eye for detail and a desire to ensure data quality?  Do you possess expertise in data governance tools and frameworks, eager to shape the future of our data landscape?   Become a Data Governance Leader: Leverage your 5+ years of experience to implement and maintain      robust data governance practices, ensuring the integrity, accuracy, and      security of our data assets. Champion collaboration by working closely with stakeholders across      the organization to define data governance policies, standards, and      procedures. Become an expert in Azure Purview and Databricks Unity Catalog,      utilizing these powerful tools to manage data lineage, metadata, and data      quality metrics. Proactively identify and address data quality issues, ensuring data      remains clean, consistent, and trustworthy. Develop and maintain data dictionaries and glossaries to promote      clear understanding of data definitions and usage. Monitor data access and usage, enforcing data security protocols      and access controls. Stay up-to-date on emerging data governance trends and best      practices, continuously improving our data governance framework. The Ideal Candidate: 5+ years of experience as a data governance analyst, data steward, or a related role. In-depth knowledge of data governance principles, methodologies, and best practices. Proven experience with data governance tools such as Azure Purview and Databricks Unity Catalog (a plus). Strong SQL proficiency for data analysis and querying. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and address data quality issues. Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams across the organization A strong commitment to data quality and a passion for data accuracy. Ready to embark on this exciting journey and become a Senior Data Governance Analyst?  Send us your resume and tell us why you're the perfect candidate to join our team!
column11: Metadata, Azure Databricks, Data Governance, SQL

column2: Project Role : Data Modeler Project Role Description : Work with key business representatives, data owners, end users, application designers and data architects to model current and new data.  Must have skills : Apache Kafka Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Graduation Summary :As a Data Modeler, you will be responsible for working with key business representatives, data owners, end users, application designers, and data architects to model current and new data using Apache Kafka. Your typical day will involve designing and implementing data models, ensuring data quality and integrity, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver impactful data-driven solutions.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design and implement data models using Apache Kafka, ensuring data quality and integrity. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including key business representatives, data owners, end users, application designers, and data architects, to model current and new data. Develop and maintain data dictionaries, data flow diagrams, and other documentation related to data modeling. Ensure compliance with data security and privacy policies and regulations, including GDPR and CCPA. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Experience with Apache Kafka. Good To Have Skills:Experience with other data modeling tools and technologies, such as ERwin or ER/Studio. Strong understanding of data modeling concepts and techniques, including conceptual, logical, and physical data models. Experience with data analysis and profiling tools, such as Talend or Informatica. Solid grasp of SQL and other database technologies, including Oracle, MySQL, and SQL Server. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Apache Kafka. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information systems, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful data-driven solutions. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification Graduation

column2: Project Role : Data Modeler Project Role Description : Work with key business representatives, data owners, end users, application designers and data architects to model current and new data.  Must have skills : AWS Glue Good to have skills : Teradata BI, MongoDB, Ab Initio Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE or BTech Summary :As an AWS Glue Data Modeler, you will be responsible for modeling current and new data, working with key business representatives, data owners, end users, application designers, and data architects. Your typical day will involve working with AWS Glue, Teradata BI, MongoDB, and Ab Initio to develop and maintain data models for our clients.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design and develop data models using AWS Glue for current and new data. Collaborate with key business representatives, data owners, end users, application designers, and data architects to ensure data models meet business requirements. Develop and maintain data models using Teradata BI, MongoDB, and Ab Initio. Ensure data models are scalable, efficient, and maintainable. Provide technical guidance and support to team members and stakeholders. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Experience with AWS Glue. Good To Have Skills:Experience with Teradata BI, MongoDB, and Ab Initio. Strong understanding of data modeling concepts and techniques. Experience with database design and development. Experience with ETL tools and processes. Experience with data warehousing and data integration. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 5 - 6 years of experience in AWS Glue. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful data-driven solutions. This position is based at our Pune office.

column2: The Data Management Analyst of Data Quality is responsible for the technical implementation and management of data profiling, data quality and data governance solutions in a cloud environment.              This role involves configuring and maintaining these tools to ensure that data is well-governed, cataloged, and accessible in a secure and compliant manner.                      You take pride knowing your work enables innovation and helping Sanofi build better solutions.                                      Our vision for digital, data analytics and AI                              AI Factory - Versatile Teams Operating in Cross Functional Pods:            Utilizing digital and data resources to develop AI products, bringing data management, AI and product development skills to products, programs and projects to create an agile, fulfilling and meaningful work environment.                                    Leading Edge Tech Stack:            Experience build products that will be deployed globally on a leading-edge tech stack.                                        World Class Mentorship and Training:            Working with renowned leaders and academics in machine learning to further develop your skillsets.                                Job Highlights:                                  Design, develop, and document the standard data quality rules that can be applicable for all data assets.                  Ability to design the technical and functional design document for Data Quality use cases highlighting the CDQ mapplets, workflows, and rules for deploying data quality rules and bring up scorecards in CDGC.                              Perform the data quality tasks, including profiling, validation, standardization, and error handling using CDQ/CDI and CDGC                              Frame the leading practices, emerging tools and technologies and enterprise initiatives to provide ongoing improvements and recommendations for data quality rules maintenance, along with data profiling and data catalog.                              Participate in the identification and remediation of data quality issues in the functions                              Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data quality use cases and recommend what enhancement are required to the existing Data Quality Framework                              Provide technical guidance on Data Quality best practices, technical capabilities, and troubleshooting issues.                              Ensure data security and compliance with relevant data protection regulations (eg, GDPR, HIPAA) by implementing access controls, encryption, and auditing mechanisms.                              Collaborate with Offshore Lead and help in tracking/updating the project/program plan, report risks/issues, and mitigation strategy for program management purpose.                              Partner with Data Stewards and DML across the organization to operationalize all aspects of Data Quality, to support effective data decisions, escalations, and issue resolution.                              Create and maintain documentation on data processes, data models, and data flows for the organization.                              Key Functional Requirements Qualifications:                                          Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.                              Proven experience in Data Governance with a focus on Informatica technology stack                              Proven experience in data management, with a focus on Informatica IDQ, CDQ, CDP, CDI                              Proficient at writing SQL queries and verifying the results.                              Strong understanding of data governance principles, data quality, data integration, and data security.                              Familiarity with data protection regulations and best practices.                              Proficiency in data modeling, data quality, metadata management, and data cataloging.                              Expertise in working on the cloud environment.                              Excellent communication and teamwork skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.                              Certification in Informatica CDGC or Informatica AXON/EDC/IDQ/CDQ data governance tools is a plus.                              Key Competencies:                                          Communication and Facilitation with Good technical documentation skill.                              Understanding of Data Management principles, data governance best practices                              Proficiency in Tool like Informatica Cloud Data Profiling (CDP), Cloud Data Quality (CDQ), Cloud Data Integration (CDI)                              Problem Solving capacity.                              Proficient at writing SQL queries and verifying the results.                              Adaptability and Continuous Learning                              Good understanding of data governance principals.                              Familiar with RDBMS like Oracle, understanding the data modeling, and excel in PL-SQL.                              Good understanding of data governance principals.                              Nice to haves:                                      Experience working in life sciences/pharmaceutical industry is a plus.                                  Certification in Informatica CDGC/CDQ/CDP or similar data management tools is a plus
column11: Data management, Data modeling, HIPAA, Healthcare, Data analytics, Life sciences, Data quality, Troubleshooting, Oracle, Information technology

column2: The technology that once promised to simplify patient care has brought more issues than anyone ever anticipated     At Innovaccer, we defeat this beast by making full use of all the data Healthcare has worked so hard to collect, and replacing long-standing problems with ideal solutions     Data is our bread and butter for innovation     We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst for the BI sub-team within the analytics team who can help us build the next generation of dashboards, reports, and other analytics for our customers in the provider/payer market           A Day in the Life          Creating Physical models and dB objects for New expanding existing Subject areas related to health care.     Working with various cross functional and technical teams .      You will be dealing with extremely unique Innovaccer Proprietary Data Structures.     You will face various challenges as you adapt data models and ensure engagement with the evolving data landscape. However you will have an amazing team to help and back you up.     You will work very closely with development and SRE teams to ensure effective implementation and physicalization is occurring.      You will be Constantly be working on the Schema Migration process to ensure timely delivery. Brainstorm Query profiling, break down query plans etc     Come up with optimal storage patterns and designs for LOB data structures       Previous experience in dealing with migration of high volume databases from traditional database platforms to modern columnar    (MPP) platforms       Exposure in working with multi tenant platforms     Extensive experience in working with and advising data engineering teams related to high volume data ingestion and transformation pipelines

column2: As a Senior Data Warehouse Expert, you will play a critical role in the development and implementation of an Operational Data Warehouse (OEDW) system for our client. This initiative aims to create a Single Source of Truth (SSOT) for their diverse data sources, ensuring data symmetry, scalability, and security, and serving as both an Operational Data Store and a Business Intelligence (BI) repository. You will work closely with our client's Data Management department, leveraging your expertise in data warehousing and BI platforms to drive the success of this project.         Key Responsibilities:            Data Warehouse Development:    Lead the design, development, and maintenance of the Operational Data Warehouse (OEDW) system, ensuring it aligns with the client's business goals and data model architecture provided by the Data Management department.       Data Integration:    Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various source systems, including Oracle NetSuite, Salesforce, ServiceNow (SNOW), Workday, and Azure Cloud repositories (Fivetran, DBT, Databricks).       Data Transformation:    Implement data transformation processes to ensure data quality, consistency, and accuracy within the OEDW, utilizing best practices and industry standards.       Security and Compliance:    Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations and industry standards, including data encryption, access controls, and auditing.     Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the OEDW's performance, identifying and addressing bottlenecks and inefficiencies.       BI Repository:    Act as a key contributor to the OEDW's role as a Business Intelligence (BI) repository, enabling data visualization and reporting using tools such as Microsoft Power BI.       Documentation:    Maintain comprehensive documentation of data warehouse processes, data lineage, and configurations.     Vendor Interaction: Collaborate with vendors and external partners to ensure seamless integration and support for BI and data warehouse platforms.     Team Collaboration: Mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.

column2: The data management assistant will support the IIHS Urban Fellows Programme (UFP) faculty, learners and IIHS staff on a range of data management tasks related to the Learning Management System (LMS), and academic data related work for a range of collaterals.          The incumbent will work in close coordination with the IIHS Academic Office and relevant teams to ensure reliable data and Moodle support for programme management and recording.      The role requires following the UFP timeline and processes throughout all stages, and interacting effectively and professionally, with an ability to maintain confidentiality of information and records.          This is a contractual position for an initial term of 11 months, renewable on mutual consent, with the potential to turn into a regular position over time.            Activities and Tasks        Responsibilities would include, but not be limited to, the following:        Working closely with the IIHS Urban Informatics Lab (UIL) team to understand, learn and deliver student data systems, especially during the admissions cycle, followed by regular updates of student and alumni data; creating and delivering visual collaterals and data analysis from academic and learner data across the years for various internal and external facing collaterals like reports, website, prospectus, brochures, etc.; and coordinating with the Academic Office for requirements throughout the year at different stages of the programme;      Compiling and organising academic and learner data as required; maintaining and updating relevant UFP records and documents with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail;      Assisting the Placements, Alumni and Outreach teams in the Academic Office to update student information throughout the programme and after programme completion, as required;      Providing support to the Academic Office to manage the Moodle LMS, including managing faculty and learner access and settings; setting up and managing programs and courses, actively coordinating with faculty and learners for course material, assignments and submissions; assisting in transcript generation according to the UFP assessment framework and helping to develop a system for handling digital/ physical transcript requests for different learner requirements;      Conducting training/ creating a self-directed manual for Moodle LMS users; trouble shooting; and managing archives and backup systems in coordination with the IIHS IT and Digital Blended Learning (DBL) teams;      Participating and supporting in other activities of the Urban Fellows Programme at IIHS as necessary; , and performing miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned;      Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations and others;      Participating in all activities of Institution-Building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and traveling on IIHS work within or outside the country as and when needed.              Structure and Reporting        The data management assistant will be an External Consultant coordinating with the Senior Manager- Academic Office and will be required to collaborate effectively with the Academic Committee, the UIL team, other internal teams and external individuals/organisations, and students, as required.            Person Specification        The ideal candidate should have:        A Bachelor s degree in communications, graphic and visual design, journalism, media studies, or other related degrees;      1-2 years of experience with LMS systems, data management, data systems, creating infographics, marketing/ communication collateral design and other related skills;      Proficiency in English (verbal and written); and the ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing;      Ability to think and produce collaterals creatively around data and data systems;      Attention to detail, rigor and self- driven energy to ideate on data needs to support and build out the IIHS Academic Program, especially with regard to managing and updating data systems and academic information;      Ability to maintain the confidentiality of records and information;      Technology: LMS systems; Data analysis skills; working knowledge of design software, such as InDesign/ Adobe Illustrator; good working knowledge of Excel; working knowledge of R/ Python/ d3JS or any other data and visualization software would be strongly preferred;      Basic working knowledge of other MS Office platforms, Google Forms and Spreadsheets;      Intense curiosity to learn and continuously self-upgrade on data and visualization skills.
column11: Data analysis, Software design, LMS, Data management, Illustrator, Moodle, MS Office, Marketing communication, Python, Visual Design

Design and implement data integration solutions to bring together data from various systems into our CMS solutions.        Standardize the data feed and flow within our CMS solutions to ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity.        Develop and maintain data mappings, transformations, and workflows to facilitate the exchange of data between systems.        Configure and optimize CMS platforms to support efficient content creation, management, and delivery processes.        Provide training and support to clients on how to use and maintain CMS solutions, and troubleshoot any issues that arise.        Stay updated on the latest CMS technologies and best practices, and incorporate them into our solutions.        Collaborate with internal teams to drive innovation and continuous improvement in our CMS offerings. column2: The Specialist - Data Management position is part of Marsh s Knowledge Services team serving the Operations and Technology business     The successful candidate will support the analysis of existing and prospective transactional and analytical systems from a data perspective to support transformation efforts and business need     Key to the candidate s success will be their ability to dig into data to answer business questions     The objective is to build a team of topflight data management professionals that can sit at the intersection of business and operational users and technology developers to ensure that systems adhere to industry best practices while delivering against complex business requirements     The scope includes all data domains, data types, data structures, regions, classifications, systems and users     This is a hands-on position that requires a willingness to dig deep into system processes and data assets to create knowledge bases that will allow users and systems to operate more efficiently and derive more value from our data assets     This position involves communication and collaboration with a broad set of stakeholders     This position is based out of the Marsh McLennan Global Services India Private Limited (MMGS), the shared service centre of excellence located in Mumbai           We will count on you to:         Work with business users to understand their questions, requirements, and desired outcomes   Perform data analysis on centralized data masters, source system data, and other data sources/assets to understand data disposition, data linkages across the ecosystem, data quality, data values, etc.   Work to understand how logical processes and solutions integrate data between systems and the central data masters. Contribute analysis to design and development of how data is integrated throughout the ecosystem.   Support various O&T and business teams with data analysis of current and future state   Guide the relevant IT teams on data integration to data masters   Work collaboratively with the Technology and Data Governance teams in the creation and maintenance of data taxonomies and conceptual data models for key referential and transaction master data systems.   Work collaboratively with various Technology and Data Management teams to create and maintain a suite of data quality rules, KPI and SLAs for all in-scope systems.   Work collaboratively with Data Governance team to Identify Critical Data Elements (CDEs) for in-scope, prioritized use cases.         What you need to have:         Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Systems   3-5 years of experience in Data Management, Governance and Analytics   A deep and abiding appreciation for all things data its role, impact, challenges, and potential with an organization.   A strong willingness to learn a new domain--getting into its deepest details and being hands-on.   Experience writing SQL statements and working with different database structures (e.g. Hadoop Hive, Mongo DB, Oracle, Athena) and various Data Governance (particularly Informatica), Data Quality, Data Virtualization (e.g. Dremio) and Data Visualization tools (particularly Qlik).   Experience with the data lifecycle from identification to sourcing to ingestion to transformation to classifications to modelling to storage to analytics and visualization.   Ability to think creatively (vs. by rote) to ensure completeness, accuracy, and utility.   Some experience in reporting data analysis results clearly and comprehensively   Good written and verbal communication skills leveraging both traditional (e.g. Office; Teams) tools as well as software lifecycle tools (e.g. Jira, ADO)   Ability and willingness to collaborate at all levels of an global organization to ensure the successful implementation of change   An inquisitive mind that is not afraid to question current ways of thinking         What makes you stand out?         Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain the complex problems and solutions in the easiest of way to the stake holders   Understanding of information (e.g. sources, identifiers, standards, glossaries, and taxonomies) within the insurance industry data domain.   Understanding all procedural and technical aspects of the data management process   Familiarity with data modeling (e.g. ERWin) and design methods and tools   Familiarity with various analytical and business intelligence methods and tools   An interest in emerging technologies and knowledge of the InsurTech/FinTech landscape   The ability to ask probing questions without getting frustrated and without frustrating others (e.g. the domain and subject matter experts).   Experience decomposing system processes from a workflow perspective to drive performance enhancements.   Working knowledge of Agile and other SDLC methodologies, including producing user stories and participating in sprints and daily scrums; familiarity with Six Sigma and Lean principles   Experience with the Informatica suite of Data Management and Governance tools               Eligibility         Minimum 2 years of experience     Minimum 12 months experience in current role     Should have at least "On Track" or above rating in last appraisal.     Should not be under any Performance Continuity Plan, or had any official Disciplinary action within the last 3 months     Should not have applied for any other IJP in the last 3 months

column2: Role & responsibilities   Position: Database Site Reliability Engineer - SRE. Work Location: Bengaluru. Job Summary:  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Database Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our dynamic team. This role is crucial for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our data management systems to support our organization's data-driven decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data modeling, database optimization, data governance, and collaboration with cross-functional teams. Key Responsibilities:  (Note: This is not a conventional DBA role which is focused purely on operations.)  Data Modelling and Design :  Develop and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models.  Create blueprints for data management systems to integrate, centralize, protect, and maintain data sources.  Define and design data structures (DDL) for tables and indexing, including technology-specific features.  Collaborate with software development teams, providing guidance for solutions, changes, and CI/CD releases.  CI/CD and Cloud Technologies:  Develop CI/CD components to assist software development with logical database changes.  Design data structures with AWS technologies like Oracle/PostgreSQL RDS, DynamoDB, and Redshift.  Design, build, and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) components with tools such as Terraform, Chef, Git, and Jenkins.  Database Optimization:  Implement database solutions that optimize performance, scalability, and reliability.  Conduct SQL profiling, implement table/index partitioning, and workload management mechanisms.  Review and guide on database procedural language objects for efficiency and security.  Data Governance and Quality:  Establish data governance policies and procedures for data integrity and compliance.  Monitor data quality and implement improvements as necessary.  Collaboration and Communication:  Work closely with IT teams, management, and other stakeholders to identify and meet data requirements.  Translate business needs into technical specifications.  Database Security:  Implement and manage security measures for data protection.  Ensure compliance with data privacy laws and CSG security standards.  Provide guidance and implement security fixes for database components.  Troubleshooting and Maintenance:  Provide support for existing databases and resolve complex issues.  Lead database version upgrade projects and implement cloud provider recommendations.  Emerging Technologies:  Stay abreast of new trends and technologies in data architecture and database management.  Continuously improve skills in coding, development, and design with a focus on Python, SQL Tools, and Cloud Applications.  Required Qualifications:  Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field.  Proven experience as a Database Administrator, Database Engineer, or similar role, with a focus on site reliability engineering principles.  Strong knowledge of relational and non-relational database systems (e.g., Oracle , MySQL, PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Cassandra).  Strong experience with SQL and Database procedural languages.  Experience with cloud services (AWS, GCP, Azure) and understanding of cloud-based database management.  Familiarity with database monitoring tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) and automation tools (e.g., Ansible, Terraform).  Proficient in scripting languages (e.g., Jenkins, Python, Bash) for automation.  Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.  Strong communication skills, both written and verbal .
column11: Migration, On premise, Cloud, Infrastructure, Database, Migrating, Site Reliability Engineer, Azure, Sre, Iac, Devops, Terraform, Cicd Pipeline, SQL Database, On-Prem, AWS

column2: About this role:         The role will work collaboratively with members of CB Lending Transformation product groups, Front Line Risk and Control, CB Operations, Risk, Finance and other teams to identify, articulate, and deliver data solutions that enable key business initiatives and/or mitigate risk. The successful candidate will have a broad and solid understanding of the Commercial Lending business, its Data Domain, and is passionate about leading transformational change.     This role working in coordination and communication skills as you will partner with three key areas: Data clients - downstream consumers and their tech teams; data product owners - APP product teams and their tech teams; and data suppliers - upstream systems of record/SoRs.         In this role, you will:       Act as a team member for Financial & Risk Regulatory reporting.   Contribute towards execution and delivery of data transformational and remediation activities working closely with the LOB Product team(s) - Loan Delivery, Loan Accounting, Lending Collateral, and LOB leader(s) across the Lending domain of CB and CIB   Participate in Regulatory Data Product Backlog refinement, prioritization, pre-planning event, working with the product manager and stakeholders to define the architectural approach, capability roadmap, and high-level objectives for the roadmap.    Simplify the E2E data supply chain (Produce => Distribute => Use) of Lending data for high priority regulatory reporting (eg: FRY 14Q, FR 2052a), while ensuring no disruption to these high priority commitments during conversion/transformation         Required Qualifications:         Good understanding of loan life cycle such as loan origination, underwriting, portfolio management, collateral management, loan accounting servicing   4+ years of hands-on experience with Lending data systems and process in Banking and Financial services industry   4+ years of hands-on experience with support data supply chain for regulatory and high priority reporting    Knowledge of Wells Fargo Commercial Lending Data Environment including WDM, WCDIR, IHUB and systems used in Commercial Lending (LoanIQ, AFS)   4+ years of experience with extensive data analysis/ review and mapping /transforming data for regulatory reporting schedules like FRY 14 Q - Schedule H1/H2 , FR-Y9C, Basel III   Experience working in diverse teams like IHUB, WCDIR, CAR, on regulatory reports.               Desired Qualifications:         Strong SQL and data visualization experience and ability to tell a story with data   Ability to discuss and understand business needs/wants with non-technical people   Experience communicating in both written and verbal formats with senior executive-level leaders   Ability to influence, partner, and negotiate with senior business leaders to gain commitment to accomplish business goals   Ability to develop and integrate data driven and analytical decision making for product and service operational activities   Develop strategy and solutions architecture for Commercial Lending platforms while identifying rationalization and simplification opportunities   Understanding and execution leveraging agile methodology   Ability to negotiate, influence, and collaborate to build successful relationships

Review poor performing queries generated from BI/ETL tools and provide best practice recommendations on how to simplify and restructure views, apply PPI or other index changes         Closely monitor the performance of various work groups on the system and make sure data is available to business as per the SLA requirement.         Optimal index analysis - Review Index usage on tables and recommend adding dropping indexes for optimal data access.         Review uncompressed tables, analyse its usage, and implement compression to save space and reduce IO activity - using various algorithms like MVC/ BLC/ ALC.         Optimize locking statements in views, macros & queries to eliminate blocking contention invest.         Review the Spool Limits for the users and recommend optimal limit for the Ad-hoc users to avoid run away queries over consuming system resources.         Check for Mismatch data types in the system and make them unique to avoid costly translations during query processing.         Review Set tables and check for the options to convert to MultiSet to avoid costly duplicate row checking operation.         Review Large Scan Tables on the system and analyze for using PPI, MLPPI, Compression, Secondary indexes & Join Indexes         Analyze various applications and understand the space requirements and segregate the disk space under the categories of perm, spool, and temp space.         Setting up the database hierarchy that includes database creation and management of objects such as users, Roles, Profiles, tables, views.         Maintain profiles, roles, access rights and permissions for Teradata user groups and objects.         Generate periodic performance reports using PDCR and identify bottlenecks with the system performance.         Establish PDCR canary performance baselines. Utilize standard canary queries to identify variance from baseline.         Effective usage of TASM & Priority distribution to penalize the resource intensive queries, Give high priority to business-critical workloads, Throttling of different workloads for optimal throughput and provide performance reports to check workload management health.                What Makes You a Qualified Candidate               3-12 years of Teradata DBA experience.         Should have worked in Unix platforms.         Excellent oral and written communication skills in the English language.         Must be willing to provide 24x7 on-call support on a rotational basis with the team.           Must be willing to travel - both short-term and long-term                 What you'll Bring               Experience in review of poor performing queries and provide best practice recommendations on how to simplify and restructure views, apply PPI or other index changes.         Statistics Management and Optimization         Exposure to DWH Env (Knowledge of ETL/DI/BI Reporting).         Exposure to troubleshoot the FastLoad / Multiload/ FastExport/ BTEQ/ TPump errors, should be good at error handling.         Experience in fine tuning various application parameters/number of sessions to ensure optimal functioning of the application.         we'll conversant with various ticketing system/production change request/ Teradata Incident management.         Should be good at automating various processes.         Ability to write efficient SQL & exposure to query tuning.         Preferably understand Normalization and De-normalization concepts.         Preferable exposure to visualization tools like Tableau, PowerBI.         Preferably have good working knowledge on UNIX shell, Python scripting.

column2: Family Description       Applied R&D (AR) consists of target-oriented research either with the goal of solving a particular problem / answering a specific question or for multi-discipline design, development, and implementation of hardware, software, and systems including maintenance support. Supplies techno-economic consulting to clients. AR work is characterised by its detailed and complex nature in order to systematically combine existing knowledge and practices to further developing and incrementally improving products, operational processes, and customer-specific feature development.       Subfamily Description       Software (SWA) comprises the definition, specification, and allocation of requirements from different sources utilising knowledge of systems engineering processes (specification & architecture). Contains processing of use case and feature requirements into conceptual models, operational scenarios, technical requirements, and functional description. Covers specification, design, implementation, and unit testing of Software (eg device drivers, microcode, hardware-related software & firmware) according to the requirements and architecture defined in the systems engineering process. Covers establishment and maintenance of Software Configuration Management (SCM) practices into software development projects, continuously building and integrating infrastructure tools and systems. column2: Responsible for preparing us for our future and the rapid growth of our Destination Conferences by establishing accurate attendee projections for onsite logistics planning     This includes maintaining and tracking projections across all conference attendee types, ensuring cancellation and no-show rates are considered, and tracking against maximum capacity to inform conference sell out     The successful candidate will take ownership of the end-to-end processes for all attendee projections and will align with key stakeholders to successfully manage and track registrations as well as ensure data accuracy across all platforms     This person will inform the conference sell-out process, understanding what is required and where necessary help to build recommend effective solutions to allow for the continued success of conferences               What you will do:           Create and maintain automated attendee projection models, tools, and reports with the flexibility to adapt easily as attendee types change, and scale as the business grows, running weekly VBAs and complex excel queries. Project manage against Logistics timelines to ensure projections are provided in line with key planning milestones tied to larger financial commitments, ensuring we are driving decisions to maximize conference contribution.
